Content: We love what we have available to stream on Disney+, but it's missing an important feature that me and many others have a problem with. There is no option to get rid of partially watched shows or movies from the "continue watching" section. VERY frustrating, especially when you give a TV show or movie a shot and decide you don't like it but are forced to see it in your continue watching section for a very long time.

This app is really getting on my nerves. I like that I can download and watch some movies at home but if there is any sort of interruption during the download process, it completely fails and you have to restart. It's also extremely slow when you want to delete a download. And, you can't leave the app if you want anything that's loading to continue its process. So basically, if your download fails because you lost internet connection or left the app you have to wait to re-download it.

TERRIBLE! Has NEVER worked. FREEZES constantly. Plays up to first commercial and freezes: sound and picture, but NO movement. After that, NOTHING! I have a Sony Bravia Smart TV with Android and have MANY other streaming apps, including HULU, with virtually NO issues. Have reported this problem to Disney website (Help) and to Spectrum and have jumped through ALL of the hoops over and over again, to no avail. The Service Rep could not help me. Wish Disney could get it together already and FIX IT!

Don't know why I keep bothering with these apps, DVD and VCR players never gave me problems. Streaming apps are just making life more complicated and expensive. The app keeps freezing, long loading time, replays movies and episodes when it reaches the end or is paused, does not save your recent episode, movies stay on "continue watching" even when finished, recently error messages have started popping up. Happening on all my devices, nothing wrong on my end.

I don't understand why this is the one app that doesn't keep track of where you are in a movie, so annoying to scrub through half the movie everytime I go to watch something, the annoying thing is, is that you don't even get the ability to scrub either, also I wanted to start my subscription again so I signed in and without even giving me an option it chose the highest subscription choice and instantly charged my card, like huh?

App has degraded significantly as of late. When casting with smartcast, the audio cuts out for a second every minute. Additionally, to cast a new title, you have to end the current casting session. Apparently, it is incapable of switching, a base function every other streaming platform is capable of. Navigation is good, but nothing that sets it apart from others.

doesnt skip intros or credits for episodes. Doesnt remember which series i was on when i return to the app. When i go back to the series and select the next episode, it just opens the one i was already watching instead of playing the next one. fast forward and rewind (while casting) is so slow, it takes 5 seconds to go back 10 seconds, and mashing the rewind button doesnt help. meaning i need to use the seek bar EVERY time, which has no timestamp while scrolling. unintuitive, buggy, broken.

the content is great. I just want to make that clear, but the use of this app, both on my phone and on my TV, is impossible to deal with. Im CONSTANTLY having to log in, only to have it say it can't log me in. I have had to change my password at least 20 times. it would have been more but I get so frustrated I don't bother for a week or so & watch other streaming services. I have 2 phones and 2 TVs that I watch on. I can't understand why other services have no problem logging in but not Disney+

Surround sound sucks for movies! I try to watch Disney/Marvel movies using this app that I pay for, instead of having to buy the movie discs. The surround sound is great for the TV shows on the app, although it is compressed, unfortunately; please provide an option to stream lossless audio. But when trying to watch movies, the sound is intentionally mutilated. No matter how I adjust the EQ on my Denon, the sound quality feels very hollow and barebones. PLEASE FIX THIS!

on console ps4/ps5. The playback will not select the correct video when trying to scroll down. For example if a show has 2 season. You will have to re-select a different season to refresh the page, otherwise the episode you select will be the wrong episode. If you don't have multiple season you seem out of luck as you have to manually rewind during playback to see previous episodes if it's glitching. Restarting, reinstalling and checking for updates has not helped so far. Please fix this.

By far the buggiest app I have installed. Casting works okay, but during playback the connection to the Chromecast is dropped, leaving the content playing, but now with no controls to pause, rewind, etc. Also fun is how the app stops responding after switching away and back again. The best part, though? Sometimes the app ghosts when I switch to it, showing no UI, and the switch app button becomes unresponsive. I'm running a Pixel on Android 14. This is the only app behaving this way; D+ for D+.

The content is fine, but the TV app has a TERRIBLE audio issue. Not everyone has a surround sound system! myThere should be an option to select an ordinary stereo mix! I KNOW it exists, because sound is perfectly fine on a mobile device (e.g. with headphones). But on TV, it is almost impossible to watch movies because dialogue is incredibly soft and, even worse, has a constant hollow phasing/flanger sound throughout. Please fix the audio settings, Disney!

I love watching this (& Hulu)! I also appreciate such options as small but clear closed captions & the option to rewind 10 seconds at a time to catch details I'd missed (HBO Max take note! After their recent changes, closed captions in large type over black boxes cover the picture all around the screen making films unwatchable with it!) It is frustrating, however, when ads pop up even in the middle of a really brief short! Funds are too tight for me to spring for the ad-free option.

I have enjoyed the app for the past few years but since time to renew my subscription I have been experiencing a glitch. I wanted to change from yearly to monthly but I have not been successful. When I go to the app and press update payment the screen starts refreshing and just keeps trying to refresh over and over and over again until I leave the site. Please fix this so I can renew my subscription and get back to watching my favorite shows.

Update: reinstalled recently and it seems to work ok now. Increased from 1 to 4 stars. Previous review, May 2023: Worked great for a year or so. The past couple of months this app has become unusable. It often stalls out before I can even select a profile, usually won't accept my pin for my profile, and on the rare occasion that I can get signed in I can't watch anything, even downloaded content. Streaming on tv and roku seem fine, but android app is essentially non-functional.

Literally the worst app on my phone and tv. Will not stay signed in for more than 1 day. Forgets account information all the time. Tv prompts me to enter an 8 digit pass code every time the app starts. The link on the app takes you to a log in page, not a place to type in the code. It's no wonder this service is being canceled in mass. If the process to watch a single episode of a show is logging into an app on the TV, an app on the phone, checking an email, the the service will die.

I thought my issue has been fixed, but it hasn't. The horror section only shows 30 titles which is not the full catalog of horror titles on Hulu. When I search for horror titles by selecting movie and then click on the genre horror, I get a full list but I can't look at it because scrolling past the 18th row causes the list to roll right back to the top. Couple all of this with the fact that I can't tell Disney+ what I don't want to see and it makes me want to keep Hulu since it works better.

Not sure where to leave a review for the firetv version, so I'm doing it here. This app (the ad version) is the worst thing ever. Cannot even get through half of a movie. It freezes at just about every ad break. Have to completely exit and restart the movie and maybe, if you're lucky, it will resume where you left off at.

the content is great, but the Android TV version of the app is completely horrible. I have been trying to watch something several times over the past several months, and it has been getting progressively worse. I started title, and without fail somewhere along the lines I have to restart playback because for some reason the Disney app just decides I don't need to see this and goes back to the previous screen. I have quite literally sat here the past 20 minutes trying to watch the last two mins.

This app has been extremely glitchy lately making it almost unusable. It closes regularly and will not save your spot where it stopped. Even if you know where you left off, it's hard to get back there the way the app is designed. Hopefully they fix it soon. Update: Several months later and even a new phone and the problem still persists.

There's no button to start over from the beginning (there's only one on a Roku if you pay for a higher tier). You sometimes have to get through one round of ads by starting from where you left off days or weeks earlier, and from there slide the play head to the beginning, and then more ads start playing. Some of the same content is on official YouTube channels where it's faster and easier to access, and seek/scan though without as many ads. It seems like the experience could be improved easily.

Its not terrible, but it could be better. There's no organizing your watch list. no mini player. The progress bar is too close to the edge of the screen so pulling up device menus often accidentally skips you around your movie. Not everything is available year round. Some lag problems, and doesn't always retain my spot in a show or movie. (Edit 4/24) Watchlist no longer displays more than a certain number of the most recent additions to it

For some reason, whenever I try to cast a show to my TV, it will play the content just fine, vut will cause my phone to bug out, with the screen constantly flashing until I reboot my device. Even when rebooting, the content remains streaming, and I can't think of a single reason why a streaming service of all things could cause this, especially since it was working fine last Thursday.

Horrible UX. Have to click through multiple screens repeatedly to skip to the next episode. What engineer forgot the "next" button? seeking jumps all over the place & often starts the episode over. Even gets stuck on an episode from time to time & starts looping. Extremely buggy & is the only app out of 6 I use which has problems with Chrome cast. All around poorly built app.

You would think, with how big of a brand Disney is, that their streaming services would be one of the better ones, right? NO! Because apparently, for whatever reason, it would seem that this app will only crash. I loved it at first. I didn't have any issues, but then it crashed and won't play any of the movies or shows, I'll GLADLY change this to a five-star if it gets fixed.😐

Starts the movie over if you happen to pause and come back later, and doesn't have an option to skip credits at end... I feel like VCR's are literally better than this app. Also super slow to load, especially when hitting the back/forward 10 seconds buttons. You would think Disney would have their act together.

This app is not worth getting on Chrome. It is good with movies and things, but a problem I have currently is updating it. Whenever I hit update in the app it brings me back to my homescreen, so I have to go the playstore and search up Disney+. Then when I hit update and after an hour of waiting I come back and nothing has changed. It didn't update at all. At first I thought that I could just keep watching, but nope I HAVE to update it to continue using Disney+. So I can't watch anything, im sad

5.1 and Dolby Atmos audio has been broken for almost a year now. Everything plays in stereo only. There have been no updates from Disney on ETA for fix, or if they are even going to fix. Update 4/8/24 - App was updated to a newer version with release notes stating they've made bug fixes and updates. 5.1 and Dolby Atmos audio still not working on my Sony TV. Cancelling subscription, never giving business again.

It hasn't worked in 6 months, and everyone's excuse is that it's my internet, but it's funny because I have, Max, Peacock, and a couple other major streaming apps I use daily and they've never failed once!! While I've been paying for service and not being able to use it!! While I'd like to keep Disney, I feel I should be reimbursed for the last 6 months, I can't afford to pay for something that NEVER works.

I already canceled my subscription because the price was too high, and I just got an email stating it's going up another $30. Definitely glad I cancelled. I only watch Star Wars content so it's just not worth it anymore. With the amount I've spent on my subscription for the past couple years I could have just purchased all the seasons of every Star Wars show. Also, the user interface needs work.

every time I click on the app it will show the Disney symbol for a couple of seconds and then it goes back to my home screen. I've tried uninstalling updates and and reinstalling but the app will not open. it works on my other TVs but not on my most recently purchased smart Google TV from Sony which defeats the whole purpose of me buying a nicer TV with Disney plus but this is supposed work but for some reason the app is cutting itself off

All I want is to download videos to watch offline, but no wifi I have tried is apparently strong enought for this app to download. I keep gettinf error code 83. Sometimes if I keep retrying 100 times in a row, it'll start downloading but it might not finish downloading. Sometimes the wifi is strong enough to stream, but not to download still. I can download fine on Netflix and other apps, so this is obviously a Disney+ problem. Restarting, uninstalling, logging out/in, & updating doesn't fix it

App is broken. It was working fine but for the last several days when you try to play an episode of a show it gets stuck on the same episode and won't let you play a different one. Downloading the content results in an error about it not being available in my region even though it is. I can't leave feedback in the app since that causes an error also.

Update It does work much better now. But I still often have issued if I download a show and try to watch it offline, there's a 50/50 shot it won't work Unable to connect. It's great when it works but everytime I open it, especially on my tablet, it is unable to play. Lousy

Download speeds are incredibly slow. 121 MB episode that is 21 minutes long taking over an hour to download, while full movies that are over 1.5 GB are downloading within a half hour on Netflix on the same device. Additionally the app keeps insisting I need wifi to download, even though I've turned off "WiFi only downloads" in the settings on both the app and my phone. Otherwise decent service with a lot of selections.

Don't bother w/basic plan You will be absolutely tortured w/commercials - too frequent, too long. When you try to rewind or fast forward, this cues more commercials to play. I can't even backtrack w/out seeing a commercial. I tried to upgrade to stop commercials. Upgrade won't start for a month Will see if I can find out how to cancel subscription & restart w/out commerciaks if I can Most people won't tolerate onslaught of commercials so I wonder how they get advertisers

I enjoy the service. It has everything I like to watch. The amount of ads are ridiculous nowadays though. Also when I pause to take a break it ends up either kicking me back a episode or stating it over and in order to fast forward to where I was I have to watch more ads that I already watched the 1st time playing the episode. 3 stars till something changes

App is currently horrible. It won't even allow fully load without automatically closing out. The phone app for Disney+ is already updated yet still errors. Cache is cleared for it also & no luck opening. Until they get this fixed, I, with a heavy heart, say it's not worth the money if you can't even use it. I hope they let everyone know one's it's fixed & make it a priority to fix.

The Disney+ app keeps indicating an update is needed to proceed with using the app; however, on my TV, it will not allow us to select Update, and on my phone, when I select Update, it takes me to the App store where there is no option to update the app. The only options are to Open or Uninstall. When I select Open, it takes me back to the screen that indicates an update is needed. Uninstall is starting to look appealing, as well as canceling my subscription, if this doesn't get rectified soon.

After 3 seconds of opening, it freezes. Don't know why, but it freezes, without fail. Closed and reopened about 15 times now. Restarted my device. But nope, it still freezes. Never had this issue before, I like the selection of shows and movkws but that doesn't really matter if I can't access it. For a multibillion dollar company you'd think they'd spend more than a penny on their app

After I finish a series, it just stays in the "Continue Watching" menu. It is across all devices, so it is not a cache issue. I have let them run every episode to completion; still there. Also, there is no way to edit continue watching. How can a company with the money Disney has make such a poor app? Disney should have the best player out there, but instead it lacks even basic features.

Not a good product or streaming service. They make you think that because it's Disney every Disney movie ever made will be available. 100% a lie. Disney refuses to allow you to watch everything Disney. If you sucker yourself into paying for this, under no circumstance should you fast forward or rewind any episode or movie. This is where the second rate quality of the app really comes into effect. Any attempt to fast forward or rewind, ANYTHING, will result in the app crashing.

This is by far the absolute worst viewing media app ever. It never loads and my internet will play every app I have. But Disney always says they're having issues. Yes, I've uninstalled it and reinstalled it twice. Same thing. My other apps work great. Disney bundle is awful. And... I've spent the last 2 hours trying to cancel and it's freaking impossible!!!

There are some very good movies and shows on this app. I really liked it and gave 5 stars at first until they took away the group watch, added more ads that can't be skipped & the ads are replayed if you have to rewind because said ads interrupted an otherwise great scene. Unfortunately it seems this app is becoming the same as alot of these other run of the mill streaming apps. Hopefully they'll be able to make viewing a more enjoyable pleasure like it once was before.

2 stars for good content. But I have a lot of subscriptions for my shows and this is the 2nd worst one. Glitch, freezes up constantly. And no small screen option. I like to listen to my shows while doing other things, not possible with this app. Really hope they make a few changes, I'd love to be able to change my rating. Edit: worse now. No cast to screen. If you want to rewatch an episode it starts at the credits. No rewatch option, you have to rewind the whole episode by 10 second intervals

this gives me access to the movies and series that I'm interested in, there's even extras like cut scenes and trailers. the app doesn't seem to cache anything. if you miss something and go back 10 seconds, it has to load everything again, if you have a slow Internet connection you could miss it again. I've had to turn on subtitles just to read what was interrupted by buffering.

1. Plays ads even if you have the ad-free version for the subscription which costs more. 2. Used to be lag free as far as selecting and starting shows and movies, now there's a significant lag and various pauses each time you try to do that. 3. Never stops asking who's watching, even in the same session, with the same account, on the same device, on the same network. 4. Using the Disney Plus app as a login for other devices doesn't work, so you still have to enter your password manually.

Absolutely the most frustrating streaming app I have used. UI is fine, the issue is every 10-15 days the app will log you out and not recognize your saved password. Even if you enter the correct password it will still tell you it is wrong. The only way to log back in is going through a password reset every single time. Looking at the help forums, this is apparently an ongoing issue for years and has yet to be addressed. Happy to change my rating once this is addressed.

I just got the app, and it worked for about an hour or so. Then, after downloading the next episode of a show and finishing the current one, it completely bricked. Now, every time i start up the app, it just shows the menu on the bottom and a loading symbol that doesn't go away. Restarting the app, switching to data, and restarting my phone, none of them have worked. So thank you, Disney, for not only delivering mostly sub-par originals but also for delivering a sub-par app. Disney magic indeed

Without ads it's smooth and easy to navigate. With ads (did their black Friday deal) it's trash. The ads freeze up, so you have to back out, goes back about 30 seconds, then tries ads again and freezes again. Repeat this about 5 times before you can clear ads and get back to your show or movie. Just trash. I only resubscribed for the deal, but really not worth it. If it doesn't resolve by the end of my month, I'm out. I'll just use my YouTube live recordings and fast forward. Through the movies

This app worked fine for a long time until a few weeks ago. I'm not sure what happened, but now everything just spins and doesn't play. Tried shutting down the app, uninstalled and reinstalled, and had no change. It tells me my internet connection is bad, but other streaming apps like Netflix, Hulu, and Prime all work fine. Emailed the developer for assistance with no reply. I'd like to cancel, but it's a bundle package.

Horrible time logging in. I don't use Disney plus on my phone often, but when I do, I have to reset my password every single time because it says my password is incorrect. It's absolutely a mess. I have called support multiple times and they say there are no one but my devices connected to it. No recent password changes (except the ones I make when logging in on my phone). It's unusable on my phone. On my computer, TV, and XBox I NEVER have these issues. I can log in with NO problems.

This app is the most garbage app of all of the streaming services. It just stops working when you cast something, leave the app, and come back. The skip button often doesn't work. If you hit fast forward or rewind too quickly everything just freezes up. I swear I've seen the spinner on this app (unresponsive) more often than not. Just throw it away and reskin the Hulu app (though that one is pretty awful too).

Imagine having a differentiating feature like Group Watch that stands you out from the competition, and then silently removing it without even any warning or notice. It was something that was relatively simple to implement, yet hugely beneficial to people especially when you were away from friends and loved ones. I always enjoyed being able to watch things with my partner while having a video call going when we weren't physically together.

Seems like they're never going to fix the issue. The app will take forever to open, freeze spontaneously, and then the app will completely close. Every. Single. Time. I'm extremely lucky to get a whole movie without it closing. This is the 4th time in a row for ONE MOVIE I've been trying to watch. Don't waste your money on the subscription. You're better off just buying the movie so it works when you want it.

This app sucks on mobile. I can't watch a single movie without hearing this message every single time: "There seems to be an issue connecting to the Disney+ service." This same error has been unfixed for MONTHS now. I tried restarting my phone, reinstalling Disney+, updating my phone, clearing the cache on the Disney+ app, and nothing worked. I was not having this issue on TV, PC, ect. If you can fix this issue. I will be very pleased. Thank you.

Edit 3yr: it's worse Something is wrong with the way their system is coded. I have had this issue on my old IPhone 12 and my new Galaxy S Ultra 22 so clearly it is not the system the app is download onto. It won't matter how strong my internet connection is there are times when it's almost like the movie itself is still being uploaded to the server while I'm watching. Every few seconds it has to stop to load and even if you pause to give it time the movie will still refuse to play smoothly.

For what Disney charges you would think they could solve their playback issues. No matter what I am trying to watch, if it's on Disney +, it's going to spontaneously stop multiple times throughout the episode or movie. This does not happen with any other streaming app. It's not my internet. Last July we moved across the country and got a new provider. Same issues with Disney +. It's honestly really disappointing. We wait and wait for something to come out, only to not be able to watch fully.

It glitches a lot. There is a lot of buffering. A lot of shows are really dark. I'm constantly having to turn up the brightness on my phone. Unfortunately I get a rude reminder that my phone brightness is way to bright when I switch to other streaming service or go to use my cell. You can't minimize this app and continue watching it while completing other tasks. Even free apps like tubi have this feature. Very disappointed in this app.

I know that there is good content here, I just wish it was easier to access. The app never loads properly, can't search, and all of the tiles don't show up correctly. Updated to only 2 stars because the above has been fixed but the app on Roku has been having an issue with playback for months now. When the next episode of something plays you can hear the audio but get no video.

I canceled my subscription through my Google account and 2 months later I found that I was still being charged monthly despite having a yearly membership until that point. Then I tried to cancel on the app and it makes you go to a web page and you have to navigate to cancel. They make it super easy to change your plan but they hide where to cancel it. 2 months of being charged unknowingly was 54 dollars. Absurd price.

Still not great a year later. I wish just one app or service would be in working condition BEFORE charging a subscription for this hard to access content. I mean the download season button STILL doesn't work right. And it ignores everything if there's more than 20 episodes. How can it take years to fix such a simple bug?? Constant download errors plague my Star Wars addiction. "Searching" for shows while downloading crashes the app. You know, cause it's still brand new I guess..

This is a terrible mobile app that works horribly with Chromecast. It struggles to connect, struggles to stay connected, struggles to find where I left off when watching a series, etc. With Hulu coming to Disney+, I can only imagine the problem getting worse. Hulu is a good app. I'd rather Disney+ content going over there instead of vice versa. I like both platforms, but really do not like the Disney+ app.

Solid content, and I like that there are no ads, but I have so many problems with streaming from the app: it loses my place in films and series, sometimes skipping ahead and sometimes resetting to a previous point. And then it's absolutely impossible to skip to a specific time with any precision. When VHS tapes are better than your app in all but quality you know something's very wrong.

Poor. Always freezes when I cast, takes me about 3 goes. It is hard trying to skip an episode of something, makes it hard work, and then doesn't play the one you want, you're better off fast forwarding to the end to get to the next episode. Then the screen goes black at the start of the episode with error message! The amount of money disney has behind them and this is what happens.

1. Highly annoying you can no longer remove shows from "continue watching" 2. When opening an episode it takes at least a minute to load. 3. The sound, when playing from TV, is unreliable. Background sounds are randomly loud en voices can sometimes hardly be heard. 4. When you want to skip forwards or backwards it immediately causes the whole episode to lag or crash. 5. In shows that aren't spoken in English (like Shogun) half of the subtitles are missing or coming in late...

App runs very poorly on my android when using chromecast. Frequent error codes. Movies and tv-shows never continue from where I left off from. Basic version plays ads at beginning of a show and if I skip forward or backwards. This results in multiple ads when trying to find where I left off from. The most recent time I encountered this problem resulted in 8-9 minutes of ads. I'll most likely cancel subscription. Ad version does not work well with broken app.

Terrible app. Wont save progress on a movie or show let alone where we are up to on a series. No fine selection on the timebar so when the app crashes you have guess the time you were up to in a movie. This leads to jumping around and ultimately accepting you will be rewatching for 10mins to catch up. No Stop button on shows. Because the app does not save which episode your up to you have to disconnect Chromecast to change to a different episode. Chromecast is glitchy overall. Was better in 2020

Since Disney+ stopped working via screen mirroring from my phone to my older smart tv, I just haven't been able to watch any movies with my young kid.. At this point I just can't justify paying for a subscription I can't do anything with :( watching the classics on a tiny phone screen just isn't cutting it. Any workarounds just cost more money next to the subscription cost, it just makes trying incredibly frustrating. My TV is apparently too old to support the Disney+ app.. Sadness.

Having issues with watching trailers to the point I've had to go to YouTube instead because they won't play on the app. Prior to the most recent update we had occasional issues with some trailers playing in French with no option to play in English despite being a major Disney film. After the most recent update it just won't play them at all. It brings up the black screen and spinning circle and then closes it immediately. Tried in the extras section too and the same thing happens.

Catalog is ok but the app in itself is really bad, it does not remember where you paused, fast forward or backward is bad and you don't see the timing when trying to do it by hand so more or less you're lucky to land around 10 min from where you were... But hey at least you have a new logo and a really loud welcome sound

About half of the time it's fine. However the app often fails to load content, just displaying a generic error message. Casting to Chromecast takes multiple attempts before it actually works. When you try to cast downloaded content, you get a message saying the content isn't available in your region - you have to delete it to get it to cast. A pretty unreliable app.

Firstly, let me start off by saying the content Disney+ offers is superb! It is my favourite app for watching all my favourite programmes such as Star Wars, Marvel and Disney/Pixar. However, the main problem I have with the app, is the downloads. Even though I download movies and series to my phone storage, I regularly encounter issues trying to watch the content offline. This either requires me to restart the app/phone, or to delete the content and redownload it at a later date.

Has some decent shows but the app can be glitchey. If you stop a show half way through, when you try to continue later on it restarts at the start of the episode instead of where you left off. And when trying to skip to the spot you need the app freezes up again making it hard to find the right spot.

Can't fault it for content but downloads are an issue. Can't download a thing on my phone despite plenty of space both internal and external. My old S8 can download episodes with no problem. Back from holidays and now upgraded latest app and now can't play downloads on other usable devices so had to delete. Now various errors across all devices including one on the iPad asking me to connect to the internet as my content expired and failed to renew content licence (after just downloading it)!

It has a lot of room for improvement. I. Here because I'm a fan but this app can be frustrating sometimes. From not having the option to go to the next episode from the phone app (on the desktop it doest), to being slow to load, not quickly switching to a new show as a press play ( I had to disconnect and cast again to be able to change show half way through). I have to say that Netflix is so smooth by comparison. Disney is a big company. Do better!

Had nothing but problems with setting it up to my Ps4 ,,, customer service were no help at all !!!!! Now trying to pay for my subscription it asks me to verify in my banking app , I do that go back to the payment page and it just restarts the page ,,,,,,, I literally cant even pay my subscription so cant use the app at all . Ridicules, my advice for anyone, Netflix is the way to go !!!!

I've never had so much trouble using streaming apps as much as this one. It's the worst! I'm always having connectivity issues (with this app), it takes at least one minute into an episode before it finishes buffering and starts to play smoothly, and when I want to skip ahead or go back, it takes so long to buffer again! I rarely post reviews, but I've been using and dealing with this app long enough to warrant a poor review.

The worst streaming app I've ever used. Constantly freezing, glitching and closing. You can't rewind, it continues to play while it's loading to rewind, and you end up in the same place or it freezes completely. Playback jumps around, you end up in different spots or even different episodes. Shows disappear from "Continue to watch." Just awful. So slow in every aspect. Forever crashing.

Content is great, but the app is really bad. Things you can't do: skip intro, skip to the next episode. Hard things to do: go to a specific episode (you have to search series and select, and even so, most times it plays what ever it wants). I thought it would improve over time, but several years later it is still the same.

Previously I have given 5 stars, that is now changing. I was trying to sign into my account and the requested for me to create a new password. I 've tried several different ones combining at least 6 letters, at least 2 numbers and 2 special characters. It just WOULD NOT accept anything. So now I can't log into my account. I have tried their customer service which then just terminated just before I've got any meaningful answers.. By the way I love the conent.

The app is a buggy mess, half the time when you start a video, it says an error occurred and you have to restart the video. Chromecast freezes when you cast unless you cast the video after it's started playing. This doesn't happen in any other streaming service. Same bugs on all phones in the household. 2024 edit: now changing episodes while casting is also broken while none of the old bugs have been fixed.

Only got the extra star because I enjoy the content. The app itself is glitchy, regularly drops out and then when you reconnect it and try to resume the episode starts from the beginning instead of where you left off... on my Tab A it also regularly freezes needing restarts. Also, unlike other apps it doesn't have the feature to pause playing after a certain amount of episodes to see if you're still watching which can result in this being a time suck. Not my preferred app at all.

Really frustrating the amount of clutter that ends up in Continue Watching that you can't easily remove. Films you can skip to the end and let the last several seconds play out and it will be gone. Doing the same with shows puts the next episode into Continue Watching. It needs an option to allow you to remove things from Continue Watching.

The content is great but the app has a lot of bugs room for improvement. Navigating in the app is very slow. The app start-up is even slower. Offline handling is not good. Downloading takes too long. Downloads disappeared several times, then had duplicates(?). I lose my progress regularly; the video just starts from the beginning. Screen gets dimmed on low light and no shortcut to adjust. These are just the actual problems I'm facing. There are also a bunch of things that just could be improved.

This is the worst app ever. It is glitchy, constantly quitting. Ridiculous. I expect much better from a company like Disney. Also, why not have a queue feature? If you have 7m shorts it would be nice to be able to string them together. Or playing collections as a playlist, like being able to watch all of the Treehouse of Horrors, for example, together instead of it going to the next ep in the season.

Some problems, A little too much to list , but the most common are the desyncs / disconnects from the device whole casting and a black screen with some sort of null error. Most aolveable by restarting the device. Simply restarting the app does not solve anything sadly. Bit of a inconvenience, restarting phone every time I need to interact, but it still works. Disney plus tends to bug out from time to time, self correcting within a few days. Hoping it's just having one of its "moments"

I had no problems with the app until recently. When I fly somewhere and try to watch the downloads, the videos don't open! It requires Internet connection to start the video, even though it is downloaded. So if I open downloaded video with data on, and then disable it - all good. But if I want to open video mid flight, when I have no WiFi or data available, video just won't open for me. Useless app, as this is the only reason why I needed an app in the first place.

Hmmm. There are some good and bad things about the service. The good, well it has all the disney films and the old pre marvel stuff is class. The bad, there are not enough films added and worse of all, is the very limited watchlist. It was always a low limit but overnight this weekend, half the films on the list disappeared so I don't know what i can watch without spending hours trawling through. The only other way is to delete films of the list, which defies the purpose of having a list.

If I could give it zero stars I would have. nothing works properly. the app is terribly slow. I thought the "mighty" disney could do a better job but it can't be more lame. Edit: 2 years after the review the problem continues. Constant freezing and glitching while streaming. Wifi connection is fine for every other app, but not this one. (Samsung TV)

Great content, lots to browse through, other than the suggested content. There's something for everyone, literally. Only complaint is the inability to adjust video quality when over Wi-Fi (mild inconvenience when on basic high speed Internet). Netflix still has the better platform, but not a bad start for Disney+ 3/5. EDIT: Tons of improvement since its inception back when I posted my original review. Not 5 stars because of the ads.

buggy on my JVC tv. it's closing automatically. After the update this month, it is still closing itself, and my kids get mad, and I get stressed. I'm planning to cancel my subscription if they don't fix the smart tv app. The worst experience with a streaming app (I have Netflix, Prime Video, Gaia, YouTube). Good content, horrible user experience on TV app :'(

Just downgraded to light version. Watching movies are fine. AD before the program and maybe once in the middle of the film But wow, tried to watch a TV series and there were ads at so many points, way more than watching regular TV, that I would rather not watch TV series programming if this is what you call acceptable...watching streams on free YouTube way more enjoyable. ..

As other reviewers have commented, content is amazing! But the app itself ... has a long way to go, both the TV and mobile, especially QOL stuff. To name a few:- - There's no way to remove a title from continue watching unless you forcibly skip it to the end. - Don't bother adding stuff to watchlist as it's incredibly tedious to remove it after. It's simpler just to save them as a note. - Subtitles can't be customised (size/color) so they just eventually become a distraction.

What is the yellow exclamtion mark? Also idk what happened with the last couple updates. Now next episodes don't start until the ALL the credits have completely run and the episode or show ends. You have a ton of language credits. Plus now you can't select anything to play while something is playing unless you exit the app or skip to the end of the credits and the program ends. This never use to be an issue so please fix it. Also it is no longer registering watched episodes so i have to guess.

The app isn't as user-friendly as it should be considering how much Disney is charging for subscriptions now. Also, how is it my downloaded movies need to buffer? Accessing downloaded movies and apps while offline is very troublesome. I usually have to open and close the the movie in trying to play several times before it actually starts playing. Disney might have some better shows and movies than Netflix but the user interface and app programming is no where near Netflix.

when i tap download, it shows me a tiny menu of network configuration, instead of downloading. so i can only see that i've got wifi enabled, and accept it. but then disney+ doesn't download. i've got space, permissions allowed, wifi enabled, and i tried with mobile data on and mobile data off, and mobile data on and wifi off, and nothing. first time i saw this error, last month i was able to download normally. i'm gonna give 1 star to the app, for i can't download my favourite content.

Disney itself is swell; we love a lot of the shows. This app kinda sucks, though. It often has errors that cause it to pause or stop playing, or give you the blue wheel of death. It will randomly decide you must restart your watching from the same episode one season back for three days straight. It'll decide the specific show you'd like to watch is impossible to stream. If you use it on google cast, expect it to randomly disconnect. Of all the streaming platforms we use, this one is the worst.

I like Disney+ in general but the app is super buggy, doesn't matter which device I'm using. Also lots of features are missing compared to other apps. I don't want to talk about the issues in detail as many people already complaining about the same issues. Just please stop responding the "we would like to investigate this issue" standard message! You already know what's the problem, pass them to the developer team! Thanks

The app has a function allowing you to download shows to watch offline. But when I'm on the subway and don't have signal I can't watch any of those downloads because the app won't work unless it phones home first. Elementary incompetence or paranoia. Not sure which. But please fix. Let me start to watch my downloads without signal please. Netflix does. You do want to effectively compete with Netflix right?

Great content, shame they still lag years behind any other streaming app. Not all series have skip intro/recap buttons and the timer is way too long, no picture in picture support. Can't go onto a series from recently watched and choose an episode, you have to play from wherever you were if you want to choose an episode, you need to manually search for the series and then go all the way through the ep list to get to where you were - other competing services have none of these issues at all

Very mediocre. Terrible recommendations, they keep pushing things I have zero interest in, and no customization of the home screen so I'm stuck with their garbage. Then, they keep forcing updates. Annoying. Very annoying.. Let me watch star wars in piece! And may the force be with you (unless you're Disney)

I mostly use my xbox one to stream disney, almost every day i get Error code 42 (server problem) and have to uninstall the app, then restart the xbox, reinstall the app and log back in just to have the same error pop up again, sometimes it happens after 3 seconds, sometimes it will work for hours, but this error happens way too often! I quite often give up with disney and watch netflix shows instead. Disney should cost 10% of what it is now as it only works 10% of the time, absolute joke!

the content is fine but the app itself has flaws. using the twins buttons have terrible loading times or fails to load completely. a nice QOL feature would be to preview where you are in the show while scrolling the show runtime. Also why do the skip recap and intro text remain on the screen while casting. it would be nice to see the while screen that's being played.

One of the worst streaming apps out there, second only to the ITVX app for sheer "unusability". Never removes completed films from "continue watching" unless you literally watch every second of the end credits. Constantly loses new films being watched, probably because the "continue watching" list is so choked up. Rolls back up to 10 mins when you start watching again, loses connection to the streaming device every time so you can only stop streaming by turning off the TV. Truly awful

Was very good to start with but has now stopped working when offline meaning can no longer watch videos I have downloaded when not online. What is the point in being able to download when cannot watch them. Update. 19/04/2024 Since latest update having problems downloading on my fire tablet. Can download a couple programs maybe 4 at most then try anymore a warning comes up saying something went wrong please try again. No matter how many times you try doesn't work. Useless app

This app has virtually become useless for my needs on multiple devices ranging from a Samsung S21, Samsung Tablet, and iPhone. It saves downloads but the load time from downloaded content is ridiculous. It fails to load on my S21. I have no idea why. There is no easy way to recertify expired content. It's easier to delete and redownload. I download vids for road trips. I travel often with my kids.

A lof content to choose from and to watch. Pricing is reasonable. The problem is Android app itself: - slow search speed - sometimes cannot cast / resume show b/c "it's not available in my country"; however can watch on this device or cast from iPhone in same household - "continue watching" - rarely works as intended; movie is played from the start most of the time - multiple taps of "fast backward" totally screw the time and jump forward

I tried to download a few shows for my trip. The app got super slow and then did not remember where I paused and resumed the show. Then it just stopped working and I'm stuck waiting for the app to load forever. I then deleted the app and reinstall (losing all my downloads) but the app STILL is stuck loading. What a worthless piece of garbage 🗑️.

Cheeky! Tells me my annual subscription is going up by £30, but looks like standard subscription is still available at the old price! Very naughty to default me to the higher price. And then it wouldn't let me drop it back to standard subscription. Cancelling until I'm able to subscribe to the standard subscription at the previous price. It's not like they've even got anything good on there at the moment either, Netflix has better content.

Will be cancelling subscription after having it years as the app is getting a nightmare on xbox. Skips certain episodes of shows and spends ages buffering. The app also Keeps shutting down every 20 minutes. The troubleshooting has not resolved any issues so it's pointless pointing me in that direction.

Programs are great, however the functionality of the app is awful. No way to remove selections from the "continue watching" section. Even when you've watched a movie or series it still appears in this section stating "1 min remaining" (even when you've just left it to run through the credits to get it off) or "Start episode". App does tend to crash on TV and app (phone & tablet) so not related to one device. Sometimes doesn't carry on the same episode when switching from TV to tablet.

I find the content good and versatile, however I've never experienced so many issues with a streaming app as I have with Disney +. There are random errors cropping up playing the content and errors coming up connecting to chromecast. Pricing is on a par with competitors like netflix and prime, but the user experience is not. Unfortunately not value for money. You need to step up your software capability. What's the point of good content if I cannot play it? Thanks

Suddenly freezes, won't load & cuts out all the time! If it wasn't for the fact that it's the only app that has the shows my son likes. I would have deleted it a long time ago! It used to be fantastic, but in the last couple of months, it's been ridiculous!!! Especially when you're paying $18 a month to not be able to watch anything or spend half your night trying to get it to work!!!

Just received the email telling me the yearly price is increasing to £110. I cannot justify spending that much money on a streaming service so I will be cancelling at the end of my current subscription. It's a shame, but the cost is now ludicrous; it's more than Amazon Prime without any of the additional benefits like free delivery, books and music. I assume next year the cost will be £150 as Disney shares the cost between the dwindling number of subscribers.

Content is good but the app itself is atrocious. Very few titles let you skip recaps or title scenes. Chromecast functionality is essentially non-existent, you can't even watch the next episode without watching/force skipping your way to through the end credits. Constantly losing your place in an episode if you leave the app. If you minimise the app then often it will have multiple instances of itself running.

Good service, and in comparison to other streaming services, it's a fair price, although extremely difficult or completely impossible to add promotion codes anywhere (but that's a service and not app issue). Content is fair for the price, but it's still just a streaming service, so don't expect too much. I usually watch it on a Windows laptop, and the app there is horrible (not even a real app), but no issues with the Android version so far.

App is pretty good, but a bit buggy across devices. For example, some episodes of The Simpsons play perfectly fine on my Pixel, but on my Lenovo tablet the same episode won't play. If it was every episode, I'd get it. But it's random episodes. No consistency. Done the usual. Cleared cache. Uninstall then reinstalled etc etc. Still issue persists. Weird behaviour.

I'm changing my review today. Horrible experience today. Can't log into my account to watch or download shows. After inputting password they try to send a six digit one time code to my email which is not coming through. After talking to someone at help center on phone I find out there is a technical problem happening with them sending out the codes. Wondering if it has to do with new update came out yesterday, April 15, which I had to use to continue using the app for shows...not happy at all

Pretty poor app. Doesn't track progress well on chromecast (have to resort to Google Home to control playback). Sometimes stops responding entirely and have to resort to Google Home to control playback. Frustrating. Gets "continue watching" wrong constantly, showing me an old episode I've seen. New bug: if I've an episode downloaded, then I choose to chromecast, it throws a "not available in your region" error. Poor QA. Don't rely on your users to help you fix bugs after you ship 😵

Comparing to other streaming app like Netflix and VIU, I think this app need more improvement. Downloading is very slow. User interface not friendly, unless you checked in download, you will not know which episode you had already downloaded, and which has not. Need to add option to remove currently watching drama from row, as soke drama we may watch half way and leave it.

Unable to download episodes properly! Should be able tontag multiple programmes or episodes to download and leave. Reality is despite high speed connection and plenty of storage space they stall and never recover. Lots of others with the same issue and NO, I am not going to waste ages on the phone to your support people. Its a simple issue to fix if you have half competent engineers. You want more money on subscriptions: fix the basics or people will leave enmass.

Content is fine but of all the streaming service apps on my phone, this is by far the worst especially when casting to a TV. The app frequently doesn't keep track of progress. Skipping intros / recaps has to be done on your phone rather than TV (why???). Likewise if you want to skip to next episode when the credits role, you'll need your phone again. Random error messages, buffering bar randomly appears even when it's not buffering. Disney please view other apps to inspire you to improve your's.

Can download episodes for offline viewing. Android notifications confirm the episodes have been downloaded and there is a "tick". But when I click on downloads button there is a message "You have no downloads". No movies for my young one to watch on a four hour flight.... This glitch must be fixed.

The app is near unusable now. It's painfully slow, streaming content rarely works and required multiple restarts, progress is never saved when watching something and manually navigating to a time stamp is unbearable. Trying to continue watching a film last night ended up in nothing but frustration and we found it much easier from another source. Congratulations on making watching your content so frustrating, you're making piracy popular again.

Just subscribed an hour ago and the experience is frustrating. Parental control is set to 19+ , verified age multiple times bit everytime I try to view rated 19+ contents, it requires me to do the verification again and again and again. Chat support reps aren't very helpful as well, instructed me to do steps that required me to use either the app or browser and guess what every time I do I get disconnected .. and now the "contact us" feature isn't even working.

Really disappointed with this app. Quite a few issues. Searching online, seems these problems have been reported as far back as 4yrs! Downloads keep disappearing same day its downloaded! Also keep getting error 83 when trying to download. The downloads that do remain, offline viewing is such a pain. They never play without phone signal for data. Seems pointless if downloaded for "offline" viewing. Only way around it is by turning off data and WiFi, when I lose phone signal. Ive run out of space.

This app has been out for a while now...and you guys still haven't fixed the issue with downloading movie. On mexflix and prime, I have no problem downloading movies. But on disney plus. Nope. It either takes 10 years or it just fails to download all together. Maybe before jacking ghe price up, you go fire your development team and hire people who know what they are doing

I like the content but the app is horrible. Downloads often will get stuck or not load, especially when the app is in the background. After a few days downloads often can't be played anymore and have to be deleted. If you press play on a movie that is downloaded from the home tab and not the download tab it will start streaming it instead of playing the download version which cost me most this months mobile data. Horrible app

Great content. Poor app. Very sensitive to available bandwidth for some reason. Netflix & youtube work fine where I am but Disney plus app often fails to find a suitable signal for some unknown reason telling me I'm offline, when the others work OK. I've tried the whole gamut of restarting, clearing cache, uninstalling & reinstalling app. This happens over different handsets. Edit-Sept23 - using Vodafone & still poor. Edit March 24: still rubbish

While the app does a decent job showing content, it's not adept at showing offline content. I'm sure that in some circumstances it can show content that was downloaded for offline viewing, but not any time I've tried to use it. The app insisted on needing a connection which it wasn't going to get as I was on a long haul flight over the Atlantic at the time. I wasn't about to pay the airline $20/£20 to let the app phone home so I could watch content I'd downloaded only four hours before.

Really bad if you have with ads. As soon as an ad starts, there is a problem. Either the ad doesn't even play, and you can't fast forward past it. The only thing to do is to stop playing and start it again. Or it doesn't start playing at all until you have started and stopped the playback a few times. Sometimes, you even have to reboot the app altogether. Is really annoying, but maybe you get what you are paying for.

Very buggy and slow app from start to finish. If I select a profile with a PIN, it will reject my input as "Wrong PIN" for 2-3 times until it accepts it on the 4th try (I input the same PIN everytime). On playing something, plenty of times it does nothing but display the busy cursor for a significant amount of time. I have to force stop and clear cache to make it work. Most streaming apps have excellent UI. Disney+ should learn a thing or two from Netflix and Prime

Service is unavailable to watch content while on vacation overseas. I'm on vacation in the Philippines and I'm aware the service is available here. Whenever I open the app it says the service is unavailable in this location. I can't watch using my account, nor can I watch using my in-laws local ph account on the same app. Incredibly frustrating. Especially when I have downloaded shows to for my son to keep him busy.

Its a good app, works well on my note 8 and the tv, but a lot of the time it comes up with fault 41 or can't pick a personal account access. You have to log out and log back in again and that is on the phone & the tv, can be annoying, it happens regularly about 50%+ of the time...04/24 since last review it has gotten a lot better...worth the 4 stars now

It's been stable on my Pixel 8 Pro and my Xbox One X. No issues with anything. Catalogue has a ton of gems and I absolutely consider it the best option on the market. Take a look at what they offer! Well worth it. Oh, I pay for the tier without ads. Given how much I'm getting to watch and how often I do.. yes, it's acceptable. I hope it doesn't go up again though. For now (Feb 20 2024) it's fine.

Very poor quality app, takes forever to load and always has errors. Other streaming service apps do much better. It's a shame because there's so many good things to watch on disney but I can't be bothered to deal with the glitch app most of the time. Chromecast is almost impossible to getting working and take minimum 5 minutes to load when it does work!

-1 star because the app doesn't remember where I left off watching. -1 star again because I have to watch ads while scrolling through the show. -1 star because the app crashes in between the screen time-outs. -1 star because I'm paying for the subscription and still have to be shown ads. +1 the ads work flawlessly, can't be skipped and load without fail unlike the shows I'm watching. Congrats dIsNeY, hope your proud of this abortion of an app experience.

This app was so enjoyable and easy to work around. Until the recent update. When I load the app, the continue watching section isn't there, and when I search the show I was watching it doesn't have where I was up to saved. When the shows are there, new problems occur. Such as when I click on the icon to continue watching a film or a TV episode, it buffers and I have to reboot my phone as I can't even exit the app. Can these problems please be rectified soon.

Not happy with the notifications, If you're going to send junk notifications categorize them so we can block them, now I've had to block all general notifications. Also not happy with the $4 price increase, streaming is too expensive when they all start increasing prices year after year. There's plenty of alternatives that are cheaper or free.

For the price of the service (and the constant increasing charges) this app is garbage. It has been getting increasingly worse while casting, buffering and just connecting in general. Update: was holding out hope for the update. Instead the app now won't let me switch episodes on the same show. I need to pick one and stick to it and just let it play in order and through credits which is frustrating when you have a child who wants specific episodes.

I have no problem with the content, but the app itself is annoying to use, lack a lot of quality of life features that you can use in other apps, the most annoying for me is that there is no way to remove anything from the continue watching list, my nephews where visiting a time ago, the used my profile and since then I have a lot of kids shows or movies in my continue watching list, and is the same with the tv app

One of the truly worst pieces of software I've had the displeasure of using. Audio & video constantly stutters and resumes out of sync. Crashes randomly. Slow to load the end-credit graphics and freezes when moving to the next episode. I've unsubscribed from this purely because of the app. It's a first world problem but I'm not paying for the privilege of this terrible service. Half of half of half a star.

The app works well enough much like most online streaming services though keep an eye on it for some reason the price will increase almost double and it does not show in your online account only on the payment service you use and can come as a shock if you see on the disney site $8.99 and google says $14.99 theres also an extortion plan as well like the others where you pay for a service then pay more for no ads. not a fan of that so time to trim the fat as it were

While I like a lot of the content, it sucks that there is not an option to remove content from the "continue watching" section. There are things I started but didn't like that are still there from over a year ago. And even when I skip to the end and let it play out, it remains on the "continue watching" section as if I didn't let it play out. It's very annoying.

Many network issues, but no health status page, leaving users unsure which end the problem is on. Docs blame users for all network issues. Spoilers: I don't have network issues with any other services, streaming or otherwise, but I pretty consistently have trouble with Disney+. Please get better network infrastructure and publish a health page!

Wonderfully nostalgic. Crazy idea, under "details" include the file size for would-be downloaders. Cannot think of any other drawbacks, great app. And then I got my dad the ap so he'd have something to do in the hospital and it doesnt work on iOS. So I do a ping and oh look at that, the highest speed test results I've ever seen on my phone. Just great.

HBO max has a better app. After a certain amount of time my password refuses to work. Good luck trying to get an email code. It won't ever send (not in spam folder) then the website just comes to a halt and refuses to load. Saying something went wrong. What went wrong was ever giving money for this garbage subscription.

When casting from my phone to my TV it will play a few episodes then just stop playing. Then I have to go and find what I was watching and the correct episode. Alot of the time if I go to continue watching it will start from an earlier episode, once episode has started I find it really difficult to change episodes.

The app still is not allowing Dolby Vision/Atmos when using the app from Google TV. This has been a known issue for a year now and no fix. If I Chromecast from the Disney app to the Google TV device, Dolby Vision/Atmos works with no issue. As much money as we are being charged for the service I would imagine requests to fix things like this would be addressed in the app updates. From what I have read Disney support is aware of the issue but we are still waiting for the fix.

The app got so incredibly worse. Casting to the tv via google home does not work anymore. The streaming freezes often and I need to restart the app and my Chromecast every time. Episodes start from the beginning even if I am already halfway, and sometimes the app doesn't keep track of the episodes watch.

As a lifelong fan of the octopus, I have been eagerly awaiting this series and the accompanying book, and it was more than worth the wait! The photography, the unhurried pace, the knowledge and the enthusiasm of both of the scientists in this episode, along with Paul Rudd's engaged and articulate narration all combine to make this an extraordinary journey into the world and the lives of these amazing and fascinating beings. This has something for everyone, from die hard fans to new converts!

The app is good. Full of content. I did not give it five stars because the streaming service is full of ads. And I firmly believe that if I am paying for a streaming service, I am therefore paying that streaming to not bombard me with paid advertisements. If I want to watch paid advertisements, I'll turn on the tv or go to YouTube and watch them for free.

Pretty good choices, kids like it, but whenever we want to change an episode, I have to go skip to the very end of the episode, wait for it to finish every second of credits before the app returns to the home screen before I can choose a new episode.

Very bad UI. For some reason, suddenly I can't see my whole watchlist, probably 1/3 of it. It's a very glitchy app, seems to be getting worse and worse. Subscription fee is clearly going to wages and not app infrastructure.

It does not work well casting it on the tv. I've been waiting for a good year now and it seems to be getting worse every time I use the casting button. I would have to stop casting and re-cast again for it to work properly on every show/movie we play.

This new update sucks. Y'all are making millions of dollars and you can't fix this?! It's glitchy, had to restart the app. Also when I go to my Watchlist of everything I saved... Gone. The check mark will be there, but in the watchlist there is nothing. Wth?!

used to absolutely love this app. since it's most recent update we have to sit through the credits now unless we manually skip them. which they last like 3 minutes. makes it really difficult when you use it to help a infant/toddler to sleep whom gets VERY upset once the black screen with credits runs... and highly inconvenient to keep going up and down stairs to change it. we've stopped using it for bedtime...

It has been telling me to update payment which I didn't need to do but did and I can't open the app can't get on home page just keeps spinning was my favorite app grr. I even try to make new account not using same email and I can't even do that can't get no answer cause can't get on your home page have been trying multiple times a day since Saturday and yes I updated the software like wth

The content is good, but the player is a remarkably bad experience. It frequently freezes my Chromecast so hard that I have to power cycle it to get it to respond again. Edit: A year later, the app is borderline useless. I need to restart the Chromecast app everytime I want to change episodes of the show I'm watching.

Well... Downloaded the app for my daughter to watch cartoons on the airplane. Downloaded almost 5gb only to find out that the Downloads section on the app is empty, even though the videos are on the phone/tablet she wasn't able to watch anything. I know this because the app size is more than 5gigs
The app is a mess. Resuming a movie makes it start from the beginning. It is not possible to change episodes when streaming thru Chromecast. And many more bugs apart from that

I pay for NO ADS, while I was binge watching I received an ad. It was not like I saw a separate video of an ad and then another to continue my series, but in fact it was added into the episode and was made unskipable until my actual show came on. If I pay for ad free I expect ad free.

3 years after release and they still don't have the ability to choose next on chromecast. It's the basic things that should be available. You can do it on apple TV so why not Android? Does not have auto play of next episode either.

Disney+it's one of our most used apps my kids used every time... We have thefamily plan and I don't know what's wrong with it right now with the app or what but from our TV is always log in us out and when I'm logging in it told us that the password incorrect so I have to go and reset the password and do it all again every morning because every day it just log us out and it says that my password is incorrect but it's not true I have to reset it every day

Keep getting error code 42. Installed and uninstalled multiple times. App start up and then go into "No internet connection. Error code 42". My tablet is on Wifi and functioning. YouTube works. Netflix works. Please fix app. After update everything stop working. Very disappointed.

You suck stop trying to be the next cable company that's what it is if you pay the cheaper fee for the ads it reminds me of cable TV before streaming was a thing that's why they partner with Hulu and ESPN they're trying to make streaming into the new cable I get one maybe two ads before the show starts on max and Disney puts several ads throughout the entire show?!! Won't even open on my phone! Constantly buffering on the Roku! Junk! Why TF is my watch list content constantly disappearing! Can't remove shows from Continue Watching. Just straight trash! Stupidity, ignorance, and greed at its finest.

Possibly the most wretched streaming apps I have ever had the displeasure of using. Can't watch more than 2 episodes without there being an error and having to restart the app which takes almost 10 minutes for it to load. Great content, horrible interface. Does not auto-play the next episode in a series. Does not properly stop and return to the menu when playback ends. The fast forward and rewind 10 seconds buttons take 10 seconds to work. Way behind Netflix and even Amazon in terms of app usability.

Over all it's a good app but it's got it's downs. I've had the subscription renewed twice and had problems with it. Could be an amazing app! its good but i wish disney would put surten shows/movies in different places. for emample, i watch the fosters on this app in canaas but when i went to Amercia, the show left the app until i came back to canada.i couldnt even watch my downloads of it because the show wasnt there. atleast if you cant add the show entirely in different places, atleast et the app work to let people watch there downloads, thanks. but besides that this app is very good

like all software based things, theres a few bugs here and there, but otherwise it works, Def not 5 or 4 or 3 stars tho just because the amount of times i have to change the volume between shows and movies, close and reopen app to get the lil warnings in the top to go away or i just give up and watch through it 🤷‍♂️ I stopped caring about the software issues love ya disney, (but add a reporting system on the app)

Worst streaming app. Glitches far too often. The UI is absolutely terrible. I often want to use the 'back 10 seconds' function. With Disney+, it takes 8, 10, 20 seconds of loading, then (if it doesn't glitch out) starts playing again only 2 seconds back. And you can't hit '10 sec' more than once at a time. Every other service seems to have this figured out, it's so simple.

This has got to be the worst app I've ever used. It looks connected on the TV screen but isn't on my phone, yet can't disconnect. Almost every time I try to pause from my lock screen it doesn't work, if I open the app it looks like I'm not casting anything and the cast symbol isn't there, it keeps saying "error loading content" but at the same time it keeps playing on my TV so I can't pause, stop, rewind, turn it off or anything else - it just keeps playing even if I turn off both TV and phone.

Clunky and not very useful. Searches almost give you random movies. Could help to track what movies you have watched. Doesn't sync well. If you close on your HP and then continue a couple of hours later on the laptop, you get a random location you watched before. Trying to navigate the App is like using a tea spoon to wade through a swamp. Fortunately the library has some plusses that keep me just for another moment. But I'm not sure how long more. A single star because it does the job.

For a multi-billion dollar company, you'd think things would run smoothly, but NOPE. The PC version, which I mostly use, has so many bugs that it's not funny. It is also not fun to navigate through either. The one thing Netflix had was a smoothed out, user-friendly app. Maybe take a few notes from them because I'm about ready to cancel my subscription for good. Plus, it's utterly ridiculous that you raised the price when the app does not work properly on PC or mobile.

The app has the following problems: 1. When it changes from chapter to chapter, the app crashes or loops. It doesn't allow any more changes on subtitles, play or pause. 2. The app produces some lags in the streaming. There are 2-10 seconds of transition in some scenes that are compiled into 1-2 seconds. 3. For some reason that I don't understand, I was reading on the Financial Times something about China, and the app decided it was a good idea to change subtitles to Chinese.

There's a bug on the TV app. Almost every single time I try to open the app on the TV, the app freezes and gives a "no internet connection" error, but does not allow you to exit and restart the app. You have to wait for it to fix itself by eventually crashing. Meanwhile, it works fine on the mobile phone. During these occasions, every other platform work just fine on the TV, except Disney+.

The Chromecast Player is completely unstable and unreliable. I press pause and after a few minutes I can't resume. Sometimes the player in the App disappears randomly. Often have to reconnect. Plus the skip intro button sporadically disappears too if pressed. Oh and when I try to jump a little further or back in the episode over the slider, I have no idea in which scene I'm landing. A little preview window would be fantastic!

Dreadful, in fact, Shite. Stay away from this app. I was streaming on Xbox one for years, with no problems. Overnight I was unable to open the app without it crashing/freezing. However it still worked fine on my mobile app. I was unable to select a cheaper subscription offer. The section was just not there on the app. decided to cancel my subscription. A month later I tried to resubscribe, but I get stuck in a loop of the app telling me to subscribe, but without the option to subscribe! Rubbish.

this app is fine when it works. but that's only when it works. and it only works maybe 75% of the time. this used to be a good app. now it sucks. for some reason it stops working with Google chrome. it will suddenly stop and buffer in the middle of an episode, on strong WiFi too. and on chrome cast, it glitches the introduction every single time. pictures freeze, sounds freezes, then it all comes back at 3x normal speed then finally catches up with itself and it's all normal again.

Full of bugs. Sometimes login doesn't work at all. Sometimes it's just so unresponsive you cannot use it (I've got a s23. Are you mining crypto out of my phone?) The progress/seeking bar as a resolution of 2min and doesn't seem to work at all for seeking.

User interface is slow and very badly designed. Lags and waits in between searching or skipping 10seconds. Crashes and hangs often (doesn't happen on the other streaming service app I also have on this device). Frustratingly buggy. Oh yeah, and with Chromecast, it is rubbish to the point of being unusable. The app is very poor considering the brand. Content is fine.. Oh and the subtitles are wrong a lot. Really shoddy.

Who are the NPC's that gave this app 5 stars?? It's a slow and clunky app with horrible in-video controls. It is impossible to "rewind" more than a few seconds back if you want to replay a scene. Seeking a time in-video is next to impossible as the progress bar does not tell you what time you're on when dragging to a new time. If you decide to use the rewind 10 seconds button... it'll take 8 seconds for the app to register what you asked, and then you'll be taken back 2 seconds.

So far so good I haven't had any crashs or anything. Price is expensive though when I got it when it came out it was $70 a year now it's like $120 or somthing which 12 dollars a month still isn't bad but it's the basic package.
