No help)-- Edit: After about a week of this is worked again, but now, about two months later, again no playback possible on Phone, while AndroidTV still works...🤦‍♂️

A year later and this app is still basically broken. Unreliable downloads, lists that don't refresh. I spend more time watching the loading spinner in the UI than actual content (This on a gigabit internet connection) How can a company as large and successful as Disney not get the simple things right? Every other streaming service seems to be able to get the basics working reliably.....

Will not work with my Chromecast, will not allow me to login on my tablet. The only place I can use it is on my phone. I plan on cancelling in a few days once my free week is up. Disney focused so much on marketing all their movies/shows that it's unfortunate how difficult they make it to watch anything. I was really looking forward to it and hope the issues get fixed. I'll be watching for that.

This is a cool app! I have found a few shows I haven't seen in awhile! There are a few glitches! Like shows playing in a different language....the same movie being posted more than once! I agree with another review that maybe we shouldn't get charged as much or at least have the app free for a month and a lower rate for the next few months until they work out all the glitches! Other than that I love this app! I do hope that they will add new movies or shows once in awhile as well!

In no good conscience should anyone support a streaming service that makes you pay $35 extra for "premium titles". Already being behind performance with its competition (such as no next or restart buttons in its interface, or no good way to navigate content within viewing or without), I by no means can provide anything good to say about Disney+.

There is some amazing content here, but not having a 'continue watching' option is terrible. Also there are items that have a tick next to them as if they are on my list, but they are not in the watch list. Overall I'm obsessed with Disney+!! But I think there are a few things that could be improved!

Good app, great quality streams. My only complaints right now is that the complete Star Wars movies are not there as well as the complete Marvel Universe movies. Can't wait for the new TV shows they are promoting and for the rest of the collections to come in, but the total selection of tv series and movies just doesn't seem complete right now so it's tough to justify another service until it is.

Having the same problem as everyone else - app doesn't go past the loading screen. Have done all the suggestions eg. update, reinstall, clear cache etc etc but still nothing ****UPDATE Deleted the app completely and then logged in via Google Chrome - clicked the link which took me back to the playstore and downloaded app again. App is up and running now

Its improving rapidly in the content area, especially the addition of star was very good. Biggest pain is that the user experience is clunky and inconsistent. Sometimes the app itself needs to be restarted when I open it, and the chromecast feature doesnt support going to the next episode without using my phone

The films and all that stuff are fantastic, the app on the other hand is nothing short of abysmal. Downloads constantly freeze, I have to pause them, close the app and resume download again, Avatar for instance I had to do this on 4 occasions, not good when all you want to do is download. 2 stars until this is updated and issue resolved.
When I click and try to watch a movie or show it's just stuck on the screen a loading screen

The catalogue is incredible, which is probably a surprise to no one, but the user interface and server quality leaves a lot to be desired. Expect lots of buffering if you're trying to stream during a commute. Not being able to quickly pick up where you left off when opening the app feels clunky and lazy.

The content is fantastic but the app is awful. I have to restart it between viewing episodes otherwise it claims to have technical issues & wont play anything or respond. Sometimes that doesnt even work & I have to disconnect & reconnect to the internet before it will load. And since attempting to download a film, which failed miserably no matter how many times I tried, I now can't watch that film AT ALL. So so so frustrating. Sort it out!!!!

Obviously a good platform due to the Disney content which will only get better. The only reason it isn't a 5/5 rating is due to some minor user issues. There is no "continue watching" recommendation, the service will occassionally pause randomly and load, and after pausing the screen remains frozen until the audio catches up. It is a brand new platform that is about 2 weeks old by the time writing so these minor grievances will likely be ironed out. Ultimately, Disney + is recommended

"Continue Watching" need a button to close anything I don't want to watch or accidentally pressed start watching. All the unwanted/just a few second unfinished movies there are driving me crazy. What am I supposed to do, pull the bar to force it finish?? What if it's an entire series of episodes??? App developers you need to upgrade that part! Otherwise great movies library.

The app has been unusable for the past 4 days. Started with the "unavailable in your region", now it's "unable to connect to service". No mention of recent problems anywhere, and also no mention of fixing it. I'd be fine with it if they at least updated the customer with some "hey sorry there's a problem" type of message, but just leaving a paying customer with nothing whatsoever? Nope.

App needs fixing, the service itself that Disney provides is great and works fine on our TV but in terms of its mobile app I can't rate it any higher, it runs extremely slow on a Tab A and and even completely downloaded items won't play without an internet connection. Constant playback errors, we can't use Disney+ out of the house like we'd like to.

The Android / Google TV app sucks. Since late last year, the app becomes automatically disabled on our Sony TV, and you can't uninstall it since it came as a preloaded app. If you want to use it, you have to restart the whole TV just to enable it, but you only got to use it for a few hours until it auto disables out of nowhere again.

This app is great when it works which is few and far between. There is constant buffering while I'm watching, it doesn't automatically go to the next episode, sometimes I have to open and close the app 3 and 4 times before it loads. I can't understand how a company such as Disney with such a high caliber and popularity has put out and app that has so many issues. It's enough to make me want to end my subscription because it's not worth the time spent trying to trouble shoot

App is great in all ways except one. The default brightness is far too low in this app on my phone, even with my screen brightness turned up all the way it is almost impossible to tell what is going on in a dark setting such as a dimly lit room or alleyway in a movie. All i can see are faint silouettes of characters. If there was a brightness/gamma setting available in the app it would solve this issue immediately. I have an LG G8 if anyone else has similar issues.
This app is great it has so manny movi oppsions but it needs some other movies like how to train your dragn, and the croods, and stuff like that.
Always.logs.me out and tells me.my password is wrong when I have right password. Paying all this money to always have to log in is annoying.

Needs more work but it's still pretty good, has chrome cast and it works now since launch. Good menu layout and search flows easy enough. another plus is the picture and sound are very good. But what it's missing is resume in Watch feature. For example when you watch a TV show it will not remember what episode you were on if you close the app. Another negative is buffering at the start of shows can take a couple of seconds longer then other apps but I imagine this will all get sorted in time.

Very dissapointed in the app and selection. Keeps glitching in the app itself, and makes my phone freeze at times even when not in the app, always buffering. Not ALL disney shows are available and some series are missing seasons/episodes. Not much to choose from besides hero movies and kids cartoons. VERY DISSAPOINTED! Thinking of cancelling if nothing changes very soon!

Echoing everyone else who is having the Infitite Loading Screen error. Tried every single fix, multiple times, over the course of a week on 2 SEPARATE DEVICES and both devices will not load. Warning: make sure the app actually functions before you pay for it. Even when you do, it may stop working anyway 🤷🏾‍♀️ It makes absolutely no sense to pay for something you can't use.

Has suddenly stopped working after an update. All I get is the disney+ logo then the loading circle but nothing opens up! I've turned my phone off/on and have uninstalled then reinstalled multiple times, have updated then re-updated for it to still not work! We use the app a lot so this is very frustrating! Still unable to get into the app weeks later, no answer from development team either!

Good, but lacking in features, the download feature doesn't work at all, took a vacation and thought downloading shows and movies for the fam on each device would have been a good send. However downloaded movies and tv shows don't work, regardless of device. An extreme let down, definitely, not on par with competitors like Netflix.

Horrible encoding and compression means nothing streams in full HD for long. A buffering icon appears in the center several times per minute while you're watching something, which is so annoying. Often the content will devolve into a mess of undecipherable pixels, especially during action scenes or anything with background movement. I have 500Mbps internet. This may be the worst streaming app available; we should demand better from the House of Mouse. After this review, it got worse. F U too?
Skip only does 10 seconds forwards or backwards and takes 8 seconds to do it so is useless.

not the same as the OG Disney but even as an adult I like being able to bring back some of my childhood memories and share them with my daughter I grew up watching Pollyanna and the parent trap etc I'm glad to be able to watch them again!!

I love Disney plus and is an AMAZING app, but as you can see I gave it 5 stars, and here's why. All of the movies are in English and there are multiple options in the subtitles if you don't speak English. The app is easy peazy to use and there is absolutely no trouble finding a movie. The only thing I find irritating, is the fact there there ISN'T a free trial, so if your going to like it or not it's really a 50/50. Over all I think his is a great app and I highly recommend it!😊🥳

Really need an option to rate the shows and movies that users have already watched, also would LOVE an option to hide or dislike shows so I don't have to see the Kardashians on the home page every time I use the app. These are basic features that should already be available as they are on most platforms. A better filtering system would be preferable as well.

Perfect for anyone who is a fan of all Disney Properties (Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geograpjc and Fox) All the classics that you have enjoyed when you were a kid are here and many more that you have forgotten through the years. Easy to use, similar to Netflix. Great for the while family and especially for children and teenagers of all ages! And the price is perfect! With a nice additional 1 week free trial. I would highly recommend especially during these tough times!

App works perfectly but Disney+ is nowhere near Netflix in terms of content. I have signed up for the year so let's see if they start to add more but at the moment it's fairly static nothing new added when you go in each day. On the other hand when you go into Netflix they've something new everyday. Overall worth 60 euro for a year but they need to up their game if they want to seriously challenge the king's of streaming Netflix

Quite honestly, the application sucks. I can't download anything because it takes hours for one episode of 20 minutes to download. The when using it with wifi I'm not allowed to login to my account because there's been "an error' to try again later. I can use it just fine on a laptop through Google Chrome but with the app on my phone, it's just horrific.

Missing many functionality features. There's no way of selecting a different episode while watching another. Movie doesn't pause when you hit the spacebar. It does not remember your place when you're watching a TV show so if you've forgotten where you are in a series you have to scroll through and manually figure it out. Not an easy way to navigate to the main screen of TV shows. Needs a lot of tune up . What was Disney thinking not having the basic features of their competitors?

Consistent IP address issues (on disney+'s side, trust me we looked into it!) and dodgy playback such as shows and movies fastforwarding randomly and skipping audio. Random disconnections. Overall so disappointed as i was really looking forward to this subscription but it's turned out to be too unreliable or just inaccessible. Would love to be a customer again one day, assuming these major issues are dealt with properly!

Even with a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra the app takes forever to load. Screen times out 4 or 5 times, sometimes more (30 seconds before screen times out). Ridiculous, does not matter if wifi or data connection. The app is ridiculously slow. Amazon Prime loaded up nearly instantly for comparison. So did Google TV. Paying so much for an app that won't even open is ridiculous.

Shows sometimes disappear when searching for them and then one day they reappear (even when they are supposed to be available in your country). Downloading does not happen in the background (i.e. app must be open) and when you play downloads, more often than not they give an error that you're not connected to internet despite them being successfully downloaded. It's very frustrating.

Disney+ is great, the app is miles behind Netflix. It has now stopped saving where I watched up to so I have to remember the time every time I stop watching anything partway through (brilliant!!!), it doesn't allow me to start playing the next episode either as the previous one is finishing. With all their money, come on Disney I just want the basics!!!

Content is great, but the app features are below average. - You can't continue to watch over the top of other apps - It's not compatible with the pause & play button on head phones - The on screen play/pause is too small/close together - Recently watched/continue watching shows appears so far down the home screen I have only been using the app for about 2 weeks, seems to run without issues but needs work.

No working without internet connection. I've saved some TV shows to watch off-line. Watching off line.

It's got good content but it's let down by the app. Many times the app is running very slow or it doesn't connect to anything or it's not working so you can't watch anything. The content is amazing but the app Is awful. I've lost count of the amount of times I have had to uninstall and reinstall in hope that it will sort out the faults. This is a great steaming app especially for me, a Simpsons fanatic! I was able to catch up on every episode right from the very start. Wow, did that take me back. Always glitches!!! I get a message mid stream saying no Internet connection, when there is and I try all my other streaming apps and all work fine. Good variety of shows and movies but omg the UI is awful. Keeps logging me out for absolutely no reason! Randomly goes back without me pressing anything. I've been billed for it, and the service still allows me to stream. I've removed all payment information on my Google Play account in order to stop the streaming service for next month but it's quite inconvenient that I can't just cancel it through Google Play even though my Disney+ account shows that it's through Google Play.

Worste app I have ever downloaded....most bug filled app. At least half the time I try to open the app it fails to connect to Disney servers. Can't watch any downloaded content unless I am on WiFi, what's the point of downloading anything. After a year I finally reviewed Disney's horrible attempt of an app. Content is good. But phone app is about as bad as you can get....worste part is I pay money to not be able to use the app, considering 80% of my watching is on the road on my phone!

Can't open the app anymore as everytime you do, you are faced with error messages. That isn't even to mention the fact that downloading anything is useless because the app won't start unless you have internet connection. If you really want Disney+ stick to the desktop version on a laptop as you may have better luck but if you want to have something to watch on the go for commutes, make sure you have Netflix

Uninstall and unsubscribe Endless "you are offline" errors. Updated the app and now even worse - endless spinning hourglass waiting for something to happen - hangs and gives errors. No amount of uninstall, reboot, install etc fixes it. Even the keyboard to enter the credentials doesn't work! Device it runs on and App are both up to date, so Disney can't makes excuses you need to update. For something that is paid for, best to cancel subscription as it currently doesn't work adequately.

App is great. Works fine if you have stable connection. There is just one huge problem. When you download anything to external storage, and I mean anything app becomes unusable. Takes really long time to load non-cached titles and takes forever to play title even the one you have downloaded. This does not happen when you download to internal storage only on SD card. So if you want to download for offline watching you better have large internal storage.

This is a review about the app and not the service itself. It used to work flawlessly on my samsung galaxy tablet, but in the past months/year it has been plagued with issues. Infinite loading screen, content that stops downloading, downloaded content that won't play, downloaded content that won't delete(even when I'm offline 🤦‍♂️), etc ..... I tried restarting my device, tried deleting and reinstalling the app, no luck.

The user interface is lacking a few functionalities to make it easy and quick to use i.e next episode buttons on the episode you are currently watching. The resume to watch is too far down the page. Also when you go to choose an episode it always resort to season 1 rather than the season you are currently on. Otherwise the content is good, not as plentiful as netflix but maybe I'm bias as I do not watch the children shows.

pretty decent app. The "download to watch offline" option could be better.. The downloading function itself works well, and pretty quickly, too. My issue is with the actual offline playback itself... what is error code 42 and why do I have to reconnect to wifi in order to watch my what I downloaded offline? certainly makes for a very boring night if you live 45 mins outta town & don't have wifi...

I think Disney Plus lacks well behind all the other streaming platforms (except maybe Amazon Prime but it has other benefits). Mainly because it is hard to navigate, the next episode button sometimes just disappears and it has no miniplayer whatsoever completely annihilating multitasking. But I also think the content is not as impressive and broad as with others (completely depends on taste tbf).

Picture-in-picture mode needs to be added ASAP to Android. It SHOULD have been functioning when Disney+ launched a year ago. Now Apple finally comes around to adding the feature to their phones, and you guys hop on their lap right away to add it. Netflix has had it on Android for ages It's a simple function, absolutely ridiculous.

I'm giving it 3 stars because it has a great selection and movies I couldn't find, and because it's new I don't expect much, however taking off 2 because the app won't let me download movies when my screen is turned off and I was upset that I couldn't download the app onto my laptop so I can connect it to my tv via. HDMI cord. If these both would be fixed down the line I would DEFINENTLY give five stars!!!

Casting through your app DOES NOT WORK. I have deleted and reinstalled, I have updated, I have played the show I want and tried casting then, it does not work. If I choose something to cast to it will come up with the ready to cast screen but when I select a show it then starts buffering then exits the show. Technology is supposed to work, right? Not be infuriating and useless

Ever since the update a couple weeks ago, tv shows won't auto play even though the setting is on for it. This only happens on my PS3 platform though. It also won't allow me to turn off my controller for battery saving or skip intros and often freezes. I can't even reinstall the app to try and reset it. These bugs prevent me from using this app as much as before.

This service has a rather good selection of titles. I have had no issues with lag or streaming, and generally the app works good. There are however some issues which make things difficult or inconvenient. 1. When casting to a TV, the app will not keep track of the progress of any title, so I cannot resume from where I left off. 2. The app does not support screen in screen like other platforms. 3. Unable to remove in-progress titles from my continue watch list.

This app outright lies about its features. It will tell you that it has the ability to do something (like window mode), but then when you follow the instructions it doesn't work. It also never updates you on when new things will be added, and honestly Disney+ feels like an app that the company slapped together to compete with other streaming services and then just never went back to it after it's release. You can feel the lack of care put into this thing and it's insulting.

The content is amazing, my problems are I must reopen the app every time I wanna go to another episode also when I get on the the particular series I need to select which season and episode every time (which is a bit annoying) when I connect with Chromecast and it freezes as well. Fix these issues and it's gonna be great, I'd rate you higher for the content but those little glitches can be discouraging at times
Always glitches, doesn't remember correctly where you stopped watching, cannot chose episodes while already watching. Casting breaks... Really bad app for such a company!

The app looks good but netflix app is better as there are more new updates on netflix. Also when browsing movies, you are unable to click on some movies. You would need to search for the movie manually before you can click on it. It is a good place to browse classics but if you want a bigger library and more updates to content, the disney+ streaming is not worth it at the moment

Good selection of shows and movies. poor auto play for episodes, resume play back feature and search feature. Would expect this not to work if it was the first ever streaming app released, but not when so many streaming providers are available. Have to go back to app to press play everytime ep finishes. Expect more from a company like Disney.

Content is fine. But this is by far the worst user interface of any streaming app I have used. Clearly it is not designed for users who "binge" content. It doesn't give you the option to skip intros, 3min recaps of episodes you just watched, or 8min post episode credits. Make sure you don't watch anything that has more than one language, otherwise you'll have entire scenes with a subtitle saying "foreign language used" and be completely left out of this trivial thing called "the plot". FU disney
Less than one, what a terrible app for the price. Holding titles to charge so much without real service is embarrassing.

even if the right code is entered it shows an error saying the code is wrong. need to turn wifi off for a couple of seconds and re-enable it to skip this screen. the player throws an error if the screen is unlocked. skip 10 seconds option /player options hides after tapping once. multiple touches are required if need to skip more.

The selection of the movies are great and definitely takes you down the memory land. Update: They fixed one of the main issues and added "Continue Watching". However, it still lags often, and you can't multi-task (i.e., answering messages) if you're watching it on your decvice.
It auto logged me into an account I don't know. I don't have an option to connect my own subscription to the app.

Content good. The app itself is horrendous to use continue watching should be the very first row of tabs. When you click the show you want it immediately starts it rather than give you a second menu to continue or skip an episode like Amazon or Netflix, however instead you have to search it then click to open it then you can start watching it very long winded process. It also constantly crashes or fails to open

The app is very unreliable. Going to a show to view all episodes or starting an episode, you don't know what will happen when you click on the lower part of the episode. Going backwards or forward absolutely doesn't f*ing work. Casting is sometimes there sometimes not. For the amount of money I pay and that Disney makes, this is truely embarrassing.

2 problems. 1. While scrolling through the run time at the bottom of the screen it appears the point you are scrolling to it out of sync as the image beside the scrolling run time and once you have selected it are 2 different scenes or seconds/ minutes apart. 2. Had a small glich where the subtitles were off and there were no subtitles appearing on screen but the on screen words were subtitled in German, it took me selecting another language's subtitles and then turning them off again

Things to watch on there are good when it works! I've turned it off then on again my phone, I've closed app to go back in, I've checked my wifi, I've checked for update it just loads then freezes everytime. Also when I download something to watch you need wifi to load it up and log in! ( Also disney ruins everything it touches especially star wars)

As Disney content, its quite nice with some old classics and some of the newer ones. As an app it kinda sucks a little bit for few reasons: 1. When you watch an episode and want skip the post credits and go back to home. It will not register that you've completed episode & will show what you've just watched 2. No trailers - this should be a given 3. Some content are very short like the secret wars (4min long!)

How the hell does your app still take 5 minutes to buffer a movie thats been downloaded?? I thought the problem was with my phone but all other apps have zero service issues while I go back to Disney and sure enough it struggles to buffer and play a movie downloaded to my phone, and even after playing starts randomly freezing at odd points. Almost feels like even in offline mode its still trying to find service, of which my phone shows isnt an issue lol

The app fails to save my progress everytime. So I have to look for the episode and fast forward to wherever I was before. Selecting episodes is not that easy on PC as the list goes sideways instead of the traditional top down or list menu. So difficult to choose specific episodes. You have to click on series info as it's not available anywhere else. Could you please just copy Netflix interface and features.

Worst streaming app I've ever used. Connecting to Chromecast may or may not work. Group watch doesn't work anymore, app crashes instantly when changing episode. Lacks very basic functionality found in every other streaming app in existence. One of the most annoying things for me is the inability to access the episode list when watching an episode - switching episodes becomes extremely cumbersome, esp. if you start an episode from the home page, as you can't just go back to the show's own page.

Great value for money the amount of content is great, one thing I would have to point out is that if you chose continue watching a show from the home screen there is no way to get to the episode page while it is playing and sometimes I switch between devices and it doesn't save my position so I have to find the episode I was actually on (which I don't mind) it's just complicated to get to the episode page again without going back to the home screen and searching for the show

On mobile so far the only issue I've had is with it freezing every while. To fix this I just hit the 10 second rewind and it's better. On my laptop it froze my whole computer and had to restart it every time I watch something about 20 minutes in. I'm rating the mobile app 4, and I'd give desktop a 3 just cause idk if its the app or my laptop.

Could have better controls for stopping a show/movie (not just pausing it) and better continuity when going back to the next episode (not suggesting you go back to an episode that you already watched and playing the credits for you). Other than that, it would be great if it had subtitles in Brazilian Portuguese, not just Portugal Portuguese, because they are completely different!

Everytime I exit the app it asks me to sign in again with my pin which is very annoying. Does not stay connected to my account like Netflix. When I download something to watch for later for example I have to turn on my data just to sign into my account and then put in my pin just to get to my download shows otherwise I wouldn't be able to watch them unless I had wifi. Fix the bugs.

this is absolutely useless on andoird TV. finally get to sign in and it works, that is until you switch the tv off or put it in standby then it seems to lose all settings and keeps bringing up error codes. if you are lucky clearing the cache and force stopping may get it working again otherwise you have to unistall and reinstall. the app works perfectly fine on my android phone and chromebook i just can't understand why it is so rubbish on android TV.

Data crunching app. Started using it and compared with Netflix it goes trough data 8-10 times faster. Watching Netflix for 2h, roughly 600MB, Disney+ over 5GB! So only gonna use it at home (unlimited data). And very unstable; need to buffer quite regurly while I have full 4G access. Please fix the huge data crunching while streaming on 4G buffer issues.
Too complicated to login in your tv, the link that the tv gaves don't work.
Updated for ver. 2.26 - Still no surround sound over ARC. Do better! This has been broken all year. Provide content in the advertised formats.

APP Disney+ as an app functions ok: it's stable and loads quite quick. Browsing on small screens requires a lot of scrolling. If you download episodes to watch later, look out! You need to open the app while you're landed, start watching something and then pause it. Then you can switch on Aeroplane Mode. CONTENT UK content is now catching up with Disney's purchases of Fox etc. Adult series and films are available as long as the subscriber makes your profile an 18 rating.

This has stopped working on my Samsung galaxy s6 tablet - the app opens, shows the logo, then gets stuck whirling. It is fine on my Google pixel phone and on the iPad so it is not our account or internet. I've tried updating the app and tablet, uninstalling and restarting etc with no luck. Frustrated now. Anyone know a fix? Otherwise I'd say the app is ok. Auto play doesn't always work and my watchlist is a bit buried but I'd just got used to this when it stopped working.

Subtitles are too small and can't change their style when casting to Chromecast. They state in their help documentation that you can do that on Android by changing the captions settings on the device but that doesn't work. Nothing works. Tried clearing the cache/storage, reinstalling, toggling subs off and back on, trying another title etc. and nothing. The subs stay miniscule and this makes the service nearly useless to me.

Great range of shows and movies but just wish it was a little more user friendly like Netflix. Needs a resume viewing function for series and movies not finished, a ratings option and also a place to list all the movies and shows you've actually watched so you can keep up with what you've seen and not seen

App is good if streaming, but downloads regularly refuse to play unless app has an Internet connection. Not easy to arrange this whilst kids are trying to watch in the back of the car during journeys. It seems that every time the app is closed or even if they switch between downloaded films, the app needs a WiFi connection with the disney servers before it can play the movie. Very disappointing. Tried with different tablets and same result.

I really like the content on this app, but that's where it stops. I didn't really care about skipping intros and all that stuff, but now I have to log in 3 or 4 times for it to work. I use the word work very loosely, because when it "works" the syncing is off and then it constantly freezes on me. I really don't care about not having all the features that Netflix has, but if I'm paying a subscription I do expect to be able to use it! Not happy with the app at the moment!

So it's been a while since I've used Disney+ and I can't say things have improved since my last install. Walt still wouldn't be pleased. I can't believe that the app now will not allow you to watch videos offline! What is the point in allowing downloads, if you need to have an active connection in order to get passed the log in?! Amazon Prime doesn't do this nor other streaming services with offline content mechanisms. Another Epic fail! For shame Disney!!! I'd give this 0 stars if I could 😡😡

Ever since the update, the app won't load past the initial screen on my tablet. I've uninstalled and reinstalled it numerous times, checked the internet speed (no problems there), the problem lies with the app. This continues to be an issue with this app. It will work perfectly fine for a few weeks, then for no good reason it stops working. For a company as big as Disney, and with their resources, it should work a lot better.
Update is inop. I can't even log in anymore.

love the content so much better with the added Star+ portfolio but still not as good as Prime on the Value for Money scale. so minus 1 star. unable to do picture-in-picture (Android). this is so vital and seems very normal for Prime and other. would also love the ability to adjust brightness. some scenes are so dark, you cant make out much. so minus 1 star these are easy fixes Disney, sort out the App please. earn yourself an extra star
slow, same ad on loop for 6 minutes, rubbish, episodes wuld randomly stop in middle and restart from beginning
The app barely functions on a fully specced flagship phone

The content I'm sure is great, if I could access it.. What a complete pain to use. I signed up thinking I'd be able to download the app to my Samsung smart TV,, nope, not an option. Have to jump through a bunch of screen mirroring processes, which I'm not willing to do. Didn't have to do it for Netflix or amazon. I haven't been able to get this to work on anything except for my Iphone and the kids Ipads. Not working on the Samsung smart TV was the real kick in the nuts. Accessibility to download needs to be greatly improved as well.

New content is very suggestive towards flipping the moral switch on impressionable minds by sadisticaly swapping whatever is evil for whatever is good. I am canceling and deleting every trace of my data from from Disney. Maybe some day when good traditional moral content good is good and evil is evil with family values of a biological male and female roles are first priority. For all the haters who pick at my review calling it racist, homaphobic or whatever else I hope you find you find Jesus.
Terribly slow and laggy. Freezes my TV often
Been sometime using this app, great improvement! MCU timeline is now in order! Can't wait for the next big Marvel timeline.

Crappiest app ever, dishonest terms and conditions. Tried to cancel subscription but the app sends you round and round, yep 5 stars for making this as hard as possible since i still can't cancel 1 hr later. So thought I'd see what would happen if I selected the other option 'Upgrade to Yearly' and low and behold, it works first time.

The variety is slow-coming. Whilest there is a fair amount of options, my issue is with the tech. The subtitles are black, who can read that. I hate plain white as well. Just make them the traditional accessible fonts. Also, the volumes are SO LOW on Android phones like mine. The volume is good on tablets like my kids. I honestly can't hear sh* unless there's zero background noise in my actual environment. edit: i have a new phone now and i still have that problem. STOP ignoring this review!!

This app was legit not ready to come out. Sometimes I get audio and no video. When I skip 10 seconds or skip an entire intro the video cant keep up with the audio and doesnt continue until its caught up. It takes a million years for an episode to play. There isn't even an autoplay. Disney, you're one of the wealthy company's out there, act like it.

There's a couple issues. 1. Audio equalisation. For some reason the app has it and makes everything sound awful, unless I'm using headphones, at which point the problem goes away. I don't think it's my phone. 2. I want whatever I'm watching to fit perfectly to my display. I don't want it to crop in so there is no slight letterboxing. Netflix and YouTube have figured it out. 3. HDR doesn't work. And there's no 4K support either. Again YouTube has both and Netflix has HDR. Also, Res options? Pls

Disney+ App No longer working on my tablet due to latest update. All I see is error 83. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app and continue to get error 83. Netflix and other streaming apps still work on my tablet. The Disney+ app also still works on my phone, and on my console, but not on my tablet. Please fix or revert the app back to the previous version. I have also turned off auto updates on all my other devices in order to avoid installing the broken update on them.

Awesome Disney content but there is no way in the world to see all of the content offered by Disney. You have to use a computer web browser or just cut losses and think what is owned by Disney. Additionally, it needs something to view 'watched' history, on the main page, as I like to rewatch some content, especially my kids. The really bad side thing about the app is loading downloaded content. Half of the time, it does not load. Most of the times, I have to reload the app it does not load!

Nice app to use, but searching for something to watch isn't that good. To find something you need to go a subheading, then pick a title then go into suggestions, then go into another suggestions ect. I feel that I'm missing out on many more titles by having this set up. Also having a limited watch list is also a but annoying, so this needs to be looked at.

On a recent holiday I was disappointed with your app on my Android Phone and Chrokebook. On my Phone the app wouldn't open when I was in Aeroplane mode. On the Chromebook some content that I had downloaded would not open, receiving error 39. Your app should really perform better for what is an expensive paid service. In our household we limit to one streaming service at a time so these things make a difference to our choice.

The first night this app worked great. That was the only time. Now when I try to watch something the screen turns pink! I have audio and can get on the app and scroll through options but no visuals from a movie/show. I share an account with my sister (has an iPhone) and it works fine for her. Not me (Oppo Reno)!!!

Really poorly optimized app, constant issues with lag when streaming, trying to pause, rewind, or fast forward is almost pointless. I've taken to going through the Google home app when I want to pause the show or adjust the volume, because after an hour or two of streaming it just... Seems to forget it's streaming? I dunno man, considering the amount of money Disney has I'm pretty whelmed by this app.

Content brilliant, quality terrible. Sometimes it's great, but other times the words are perfect and the movements are glitchy, or even glitchy words, but perfect movement. When you click the arrow to stop watching something it takes you back to the home screen, but the words keep going for a few secs. I love most of the content, but I wish the quality was better, so that I could enjoy it more. I have done updates and things, this is the only app that does this. pls fix this🛠️

This rating is purely for functionality when compared to other similar apps Needs drastically improve how the app deals with downloading offline content There are so many instances of downloading a show to watch while on public transport where there is bad internet reception, and the app can not play the downloaded content or encouters an error. Sometimes, it won't even allow access to the downloads at all. The other issue is why it doesn't have a pop out mode. Everyone multi tasks

Fairly good selection of titles with a reasonably nice looking interface but also super buggy and missing all sorts of basic features you'd expect from a major streaming service. Recent annoyances have included: autoplay cutting off last 15 seconds of episodes (pre-credits), resuming a paused episode in a later viewing session causes episode to start from beginning, have to wait for app to fully connect to streaming device before pressing play episode (unlike youtube, Netflix).
Excellent show!! I'm looking forward to the entire season!!

This app has some significant flaws. I wish there was a "continue watching" section, like Netflix. Instead I have to search for the program my children were watching, every time. Also, it is glitchy. For example, one of the profiles I have set up will not let me select that it is a child's profile. Also, it seems to buffer a lot, but Netflix does not do this for me. Great content, but I wish it had "A Mickey's Christmas Carol"

Look it's great and all, but I really dislike that despite me having set everything to english, the text in the movies are in swedish. Like, not subtitles, but other written text in the movie itself, despite the movies definitely having english in the original version. It bothers me that I can't change it back.

What is the point of downloads if you need to have a data connection in order to play it? Also, I live in Canada (BC). Several movies have the text in French (like the opening crawl in Star Wars - A New Hope) while the audio is in English. Cars 3 had signs or lettering on the vehicles in French with English audio. This film has been fixed though. Get your act together Disney. You've had PLENTY of time to work out the bugs.

Terrible. I have had it for over a year, no idea why. Well, pesky niece and nephews I suppose . It has worked maybe 10% of the time . For the last month it was finally working flawlessly on all platforms , PS4 , firestick , android , Chromebook, thought a corner had been turned...nope! Now 4 days of not working on anything . Sort it out !

I like the idea if all my childhood movies in one place, plus the baby Yoda show is amazing. But I can't watch anything most of the the time because it keeps loading to infinity and beyond. For my brother it works perfectly but we almost have the same phone (internals are basically the same). It did improve offer time with the updates but still barely able to watch anything.

Best content of all the streaming services in Canada right now. But the app sucks, can barely load videos on wifi, can't even watch my downloaded content, and the app will log me out constantly which really defeats the purpose of an offline mode. There's no excuse for this steaming pile of garbage Disney, load up Netflix and see what a good app is like.

Can't play any movie or download a movie there is a glich in the app. Message pops up can only view or download with Wi-Fi but that is what I am using to type this message lol. I have checked all settings and all set on Wi-Fi. App just doesn't work properly or not at all for some of us .But guess the payment side of app works fine at least once a month.

Doesn't work at all. Will tell me i need to connect to the Internet when everything else is connected and working fine. It's not like I don't have the memory space, or a good connection. I've uninstalled and reinstalled to find the same issue. I expected better, Disney. 😬 Don't waste your time, folks. On the off-chance Mercury is in retrograde and it's a full moon AND you remembered to look at the clock at 11:11, it will still take a minor (major) miracle for the app to work.

Using this Disney + app on phone then casting to my Chromecast I have found a huge increase in my day usage. I mean seriously huge!!! About 10gb/hour. The app says you can control data by using data saver but if casting from the phone it does not read my 720p tv and casts it in the highest resolution without you knowing unless you monitor your data. I will be cancelling my monthly subscription as this app also does not have enough new shows or movies yet. Not worth it for me.
Keep getting an error when casting to my chromecast

I use it fairly often for the kids when streaming to the Chromecast or on the go. The app isn't compatible with VPN's or allowing screenshots of the content if you're on mobile. Not a big deal just something to be mindful of. Also had some issues recently with Disney+ just refusing to connect on my mobile. Fixed the problem by uninstalling and reinstalling the app. Otherwise it's been a pretty reliable app for me.

Worst app experience ever! Forever loading, very high CPU and battery usage resulting in phone excessively heating up, more so than when gaming! Can't even watch downloaded shows at all, even after clearing cache, redownloading multiple times, restarting phone etc. Expect so much better from Disney regardless of the fact we are paying for a subscription!
I didn't think this movie was particularly good. Very confusing at times and the acting seemed stiff and forced.
How does it not have English subtitles without closed captions?

The app still has a few problems. It freezes quite a bit, where I have to close it and reopen it. Secondly, you can not minimise the screen with the content that you are watching when on another app, if you are for example, replying a text. Lastly, I feel that for a company with such a collection of movies and series, what is currently on offer is not that much, especially with regards to the Disney cartoons. The app still has a long way to go.

For some reason the app just won't work. It keeps opening to a grey screen and it won't show anything else. I tried closing the app, clearing the cache and still the same issue. Hell I even uninstalled and re-installed and get still the app won't open. I've never had problems with it before up until a month ago so I'm not sure what's changed

Nice to be able to watch the good old shows like Kim Possible. Unfortunately I'm finding this app to be extremely data hungry. Even set to the lowest quality settings, the picture is super clear which means the quality and data is higher and I chew through my limited internet allowance at an alarming rate. Wish there were lower quality settings so I could enjoy without worry of going over my limits. Also, find the 10 second advance and rewind buttons to be too close to the play/pause button.
I cannot access downloads offline, keep having to delete them all and re download
Can you please include a way to clear shows from the continue watching queue? Frustrating. Other apps manage to do it.
Not great. I was struggling to care anything about the characters after the second episode. It just got harder to keep my attention from there and became hard work to watch sadly.

according to the other reviews it does not have a skip intro button, but for me it does, it just shows up very late when the intro takes only 1 more second. Also when I download stuff it keeps stopping because I don't have a WiFi connection while I do, it's just weak, but then I'm not able to continue the download while I do have a WiFi connection, so I hope the developers add a "retry download" button instead of having to wait ages for it to start downloading again

Needs some work, was super happy to see French options but for some reason, movies I was in the middle of watching and stopped then restarted, no longer had a French audio option. Moana in particular since I was watching it the night before with my kids and then stopped it halfway, the next morning French audio had disappeared. Called customer support who pretty much ran me through the ringer with really silly questions like "did you select the French audio option..." issue is still nor resolved

No cast button. You know how all apps have it? This one doesn't. 2024: still no cast button. Worst streaming app ever. Wish I could give 0 starts as 1 star implies something actually works as intended.

Surprisingly good, as I have full sky package, with Netflix, Discovery+ premium Spotify & YouTube; Deezer prime. Thought I'd got everything going... Netflix is now showing very little except older TV n films, no doubt that is why I got it with sky package!! Disney plus...has some brilliant programs, series showing. Now my free trial is finished, would like to have it instead of Netflix 9/10 ! 👌👌👌👍💯

Really great idea! The thing it really needs though is a 'continue watching' category, i started watching the simpsons but everytime i want to go to the next episode, i had to add it to my watch list, then click it, then scroll to the episode and try to remember what episode i was on, it would be nice if i could just click and it starts where i left off, or at least says which episodes i have seen, becuase with a 30 seasons show it will become progressively harder to find the right season or ep

Could've been nice if it worked. Downloaded the app quite excitedly, had to restart my phone twice to get enough functionality to set up a payment method on the account. I've tried for about 45 minutes now to watch something and no matter what I try it won't cast. At least there was a free trial so I didn't have to waste any money on it.

It used to be my favourite streaming service app , I used to be able to watch my downloads on long drives or whenever I was bored and didn't have access to my TV. Now the app doesn't even let me get past the disney+ logo before I'm being told the app isn't responding . I tried deleting the app and reinstalling to log back in but it doesn't even let me get to the log in page . It usually works fine on my TV except the odd error message maybe a few times a week ,but it doesn't even open on phone

I really loved this app up until a few days ago, since than the app won't load the screen even after doing everything possible, I got really frustrated when I downloaded a content and it didn't let me watch it without internet, this just doesn't make any sense. When I finally got the app to open one time yesterday, my movie kept pausing without me pressing any buttons or anything else open in my cellphone. I'm just frustrated and hope it gets fixed soon.

App is trash with chromecast, takes multiple times to get something playing. Never remembers the shows that I'm watching or saves at the correct episodes. Chromecast is the only way I watch streaming services, so I'm obviously not paying for a service that can't run basic features. Disney also doesn't care to fix these bugs, the app has been trash for years.

Generally I have found the app ok, but since the start of August I am unable to open it on Android. I've uninstalled and reinstalled but the issue persists. From looking at other reviews it appears I'm not alone. Despite this issue being around for 10 days, Disney don't appear to be acknowledging it, and there is no information on when it will be fixed. The latest update was meant to improve streaming experience and has failed miserably.

It does it's job. If you have Disney+ you can watch Disney, most Marvel, Star Wars, Pixar and some other "Star" films and TV shows. Ultimately, between Netflix, Prime and Disney+, we couldn't afford them all and we used Disney+ the least. The "Star" shows are pushing it in the right direction but still didn't feel it was worth keeping at the moment and needed to cut on costs - the app is solid though and works well.

Previous issue has been fixed. It was working really well for a while with no issues. However, now videos tend to fast forward through some of the shows on it's own by 10 seconds to a minute which is really annoying. Especially when I rewind yo go back to where I was, then it buffers forever.

App stopped working on my android tablet. Started to get constant error messages about not being able to connect. Now it won't do anything apart from say error code 83. I've checked that code and it's to do with compatibility. My device is compatible and I have been using the app no problem until last week, so don't know why all of a sudden it won't work

Wow! What a mess! Old videos (Simpsons) and new (Noelle) cache, hang, and fail. Same failure on two different phones. Xbox app works as expected (no memory of what was watched but at least it plays). Cleared app cache and data but still fails the same. Update: after the updates the app is better and more reliable. Hanging circle only shows up when I play anything with a USB C adapter connected to HDMI and external TV.

Weigh the Cost. Try it for a month and see how much you want to watch. I found myself forcing content after my initial honeymoon period. Technical problems. It says Android 5 is the minimum supported OS. I have a OnePlus 6t with Android 11. I cannot play nor download anything on my device! I rely on my chromecast at home... It used to work fine, then Disney stated in my support ticket that my device isn't supported any more and a fix will be out in a week. Well, I'm still waiting. Please fix!

The app is ok, but with some technical issues that clearly need to be dealt with (based on the comments I've read). I've been trying to use the download (to watch offline) feature and it's been impossible. 12mb is the max amount of data downloaded after 2 days on WiFi. That's the only issue I've had so far, but I'll update after a week.
Usually great. The search is completely busted right now. So that's frustrating.

This is a real good app. I have rated it 4 stars because the following updates need to be completed and features should be done (doesn't affect the rating :) but would like to see it). Updates: 1. Bug Fixes When opening the app it automatically closes and comes up with an error ("An Unexpected Problem Occurred") When playing a video it buffers all the time and I have a real good internet at home so that it doesn't buffer 2. Performance Increase The app takes too long to load a video and the internet I have is super fast. So this should be faster. Features: 1. Dark and Light Mode 2. Option for video quality change option 3. Design Change is needed it is too outdated. If I see the updates complete I will change this review so 5 stars and change the writing. Stay Safe!

It's gone really bad keeps telling me I'm offline or not connected to internet when i am and after opening and closing it 4 or 5 times it works. Then half the content is missing no pictures just grey boxes without pictures. Its doing this on everything tv, phone and laptop. Just ungraded to the top fibre package i can get and still the same, loads of error codes all the time been doing this for a month and a half now I keep using groupwatch to and its just tragic for both parties using it.
Getting error code 83 out of nowhere and now can't connect at all. Rebooting power cycling nothing works. I can login though the Web give but can't play anything browser based off course

The content is first class The app is useless. To get it to work you have to uninstall it then install it again every time you want to use it again and whats with the download to play it off line? Once downloaded it requires you to be online to start watching the downloaded content. Very frustrating if Disney+ can fix these issues it would more than likely get a 5 star rating

Your experience is usable, but there are a lot of issues. Whne downloading videos, sometimes the app forgets them somehow and requires you to re-download them, although they are still stored. App crashes a little too much. Videos can stop streaming sometimes if you skip through the playback, requiring you to stop and start playback again. In general, there won't be problems if you just pick a video and watch it. Don't skip around too much. Streaming quality and selection is very good.
Trying to watch downloads when you have no signal is a nightmare. The content is fantastic but the user experience is not good.
this is poorly set up - no skipping intro, no skipping credits, many issues, many crashes
Can't even play movies that are supposedly downloaded to my device, constant errors, pixel 7 pro

App is ok but it needs a lot of polishing, when watching more than one episode it always plays the intro and recap on the following episodes, really annoying when binge watching. Also when casting the app does not stay live on the phone, this means it's difficult to pause or stop the programme when needed. The app needs to work at the same level as Netflix, that is the standard.

Probably the worst performance of any streaming service I've used. I have a 500Mbps low latency full fibre connection, so I know it's not my connectivity. I have tested it through a TV, an nVidia Shield and a Sky Q Silver device: all exhibit a large delay in streaming Disney and updating Disney programme lists, but no other streaming service suffers such delays through the same devices and internet connection.

Lots of good movies, especially with the addition of stars but I have to log in EVERY TIME I USE THE APP and it can be open, I swap to write a text to a friend, go back to continue my show or movie and I have to sign in again. It's annoying as I dont always have a hand free long enough to type in my info. Otherwise no issues here, love it but that one problem is worth 2 stars taken off.

Great selection, awful app, it is constantly freezing, not loading, both on my phone and when I Chromecast, not sure if it's a comparability issue, bit I don't have the same difficulties with other streaming services. Really disappointing given how big Disney is, surely they can invest a little more into getting their app working properly.

Rubbish. Slow. Laggy. Doesn't sync with lips. I've downloaded for a holiday with no internet. Couldn't even open the app to view downloaded stuff. Shouldn't advertise that if it's not true. I'm on my 4th uninstall and download after it wouldn't open in about a month. Skips episodes on auto play. Only shows first 50 of my favourites so I can't browse films or TV. Not user friendly at all. Wouldn't pay for it. Currently on a free trial. Oh yeah. And you have to PAY £20 ON TOP for new films!!!!!!
Laggy, abruptly closes without warning.

I have several complains 1. The app doesn't run movies offline unless you play it before go offline 2. The search engine is terrible, I can't find movies I know they are here 3. The "Collections" are incomplete 4. The thing I hate the most for sure, I can't access to movie features unless I search it, because if I click it on my Continue Watching it just start to play, sometimes my daughter doesn't finished the movies and she wants to restarted it.

I like the idea of being able to watch my childhood favourite however the app is really glitchy. When I'm trying to watch some thing itll flicker between black and what's meant to be showing or the video will freeze while the audio continues or the whole this will freeze in general. I'll try closing and reopening the app, going on and off the video yet the problem persists to the point where i just give up. I would also love and option to adjust the playback speed i.e 2x faster like youtube does

The app caused me to double pay my first month's subscription after the trial period and I've been trying to get my money back for 2 months. Google is telling me it's Disney+ problem to fix and Disney+ is telling me its Google's problem to fix. Neither big Corp wants to help me out and I've wasted hours of time trying to get my $$ back. I'll be looking to give Google Play (where I first downloaded the app) a 1-star or less rating as well. What a joke. I've never had this problem with Netflix.

It's early days yet, and this app isn't quite as polished as other, longer serving streaming apps. Weird artefacts on the play control on screen graphics, shows stay in Continue Watching despite having run to the credits, shows on the Watchlist disappearing after a certain number of titles, random dropouts that require signing in. Bugs need fixing but otherwise a functional app. I just expected Disney to release an app that was a little more refined, given their usual stringent Quality Control

Not yet really useable - they need more time to be in the same league like other streaming apps. Compared with other streaming apps like Netflix or Amazon the usability is really fast away. App crashed. Won't stream a video after an error for some time. If it wouldn't be the content I wouldn't have kept it. Even Sky mobile App is better.

For a multibillion company, this app is poop. If you don't opt for autoplay, it is such a pain to try and play the next episode when casting. You have to manually find the series and scroll to the next episode and choose it. If I want to watch downloaded episodes on the move I have to choose the episode and lock then unlock my phone for them to play. Why?! *Edit, apologies if you want to play a download, you have to turn your mobile data and WIFI off or you're met with a black screen.

App worked great up until about July then error code after error code. IT is ZERO help saying my internet is too slow yet works fine on TV and iphone (who wants to watch movies on a phone.. not me). Have deleted the app, logged out of all accounts etc which IT told me to do, did not work. This app needs fixing, its almost like they used the same interface they use for everything Disney related... fastpasses, my disney experience, etc. Downloading doesnt even work. Get it together Disney!!!!

Compared to Netflix, the way the actual app works isn't as good. There are quite a few frustrating things, like not being able to minimise and play in the background on mobile, if you want to switch episodes there is no "go back an episode" or "go forward an episode" option, or even an exit out of the episode to the episode list instead of how it currently exits an episode to the homepage. Very slow loading times on TV. Content is okay but not phenomonal(yet, anyway).

PS4. Love the content. Hate the app. It needs a full design overhaul. Annoyingly unresponsive; Can't look at a show's episode list from the "continue watching" section (which often doesn't change to the next episode); "pause/play" [ x button] has to be pushed multiple times to pause or play instead of responding on one (or maybe two) clicks; The subtitles don't show most of the time; We've been paying for this since day 1, but the lack of quality of life updates is super frustrating!!

Meh could be better. I mean its still in its infancy and like most streaming services it favours their American based customers more. It doesn't have all the xmen movies yet but the OG 90s cartoon so saving grace there. Also it will remove items you have watched but be careful as if you watch a series to finish it will tick back to episode 1 of season one and it will be stuck in your watch list forever.
is very good to watch your favourite classic Disney movie on this app

Up until now, the app has worked perfectly on my phone. But today its decided to stop working altogether. I've spent the last 15 minutes trying to watch more than 10 seconds of The Clone Wars. Unfortunately, after that time, the video freezes with the audio continuing to play. I've uninstalled then reinstalled, used mobile data instead of WiFi (so I know its on your end and not my connection) and closed and reopened the app several times. Not working. For such a big company, this is shameful.

Wauw, this just doesnt work in Europe! Such a shame...i paid a year upfront without testing it, since NF works fine here. Im in Greece right now, with fast 4G/5G on my phone. (60mbps on a good day). Netflix in 4k on multiple bigscreens works fine. However, Disney just sucks. Movies hang. App doesnt even open sometimes, it just hangs on the home screen trying to get content. I understand the whole world wide server thing is extremely difficult to setup, and Disney's new, but still. Fix it!

Great. Basically includes everything I'm missing from Netflix. Unfortunately doesn't include the (Marvel) Spiderman movies, obviously just to be annoying. The video player itself also feels low budget; rewinding even 10 seconds incurrs a loading sign which lasts around 5 seconds every time. This is follwed by a lag and sometimes the stream even stops completely. Disney have plenty of room for improvement here. Hopefully they don't dawdle.

The movie selection is fair but it freezes constantly! I have unlimited high speed Wi-Fi and this freaking movie app is ALWAYS freezing and reloading. I am NOT impressed with it and i have paid for the year. I will NOT be renewing. At least Netflix loads properly and never freezes. I would not recommend this new movie/tv site to anyone!

A long way to go until it competes with the UX of other streaming apps. Your watchlist isn't on the front page, no quick way to skip credits or the next episode countdown, VERY clunky episode selection for anything later than season 1, feels like I have to restart my phone on a daily basis because the app stops recognising my Google Chrome, and the app keeps logging me out randomly. A chore to use, which I'll remember when I run out of new content and cancel my subscription.

Pretty useless. Still has a lot of work to be done. App doesn't work flawlessly. It takes forever to load and buffer on the app. I haven't tried it on my smarttv or laptop yet. Thank God it's a free trial. I might just cancel the subscription before they charge me and just wait till they fix the kinks.

What's happening with the sound? My brand new smart TV where others apps works perfectly, Disney + do not sounds any good. It seems that the doubly is interfering with audio output. I hear just parts of the sounds. I tried everything, putting the sound in each mode, linking it with other sound devices without any changes... TV works with the competence (sorry for the comparison). So. What I should do?

When running this app and downloading movies onto Internal Storage, the app works perfectly fine. When downloading the movies onto microSD, the app runs extremely slow and sometimes crashes. This issue has gone on ever since the app has launched and it has never been fixed since then. I do not want to be forced to use up my internal storage space.
When I continue watching a programme it starts back at the beginning. This didn't used to happen

Last update made this app junk again. Thanks Dev team for taking an app that was could be used and turn it into junk again. I download shows to watch on the road, and as soon as I drive by a wifi signal...ANY wifi signal, all the downloaded shows can't be found any more...even though it shows they're still there in the "downloads" section of the app. Thank you again Dev Team, you made something usable into something useless.

It's ridiculous that none of my downloaded shows play when I'm offline. If Netflix can do it then Disney plus should be able to. Disney has the option it just doesn't work. Also, it should be able to do what Netflix does and make the screen small so you can do other things while you're watching your show. It should have a minimize option. In this day and age we all need to be able to multitask

This app is very difficult to install on Samsung S10+. I managed to install it once. But not the second time. This was with the latest android patch available on 20.12.2019. The symptoms are, the installation does not complete. The progress may takes many hrs and still stops at the last few kilo bytes. I did get the app to load in the android patch prior to the latest. There was a problem with audio using Chromecast. Hence the reinstall. But the latest install has not gone on to complete.

Good app ! But I miss two things : • I miss the control of luminosity when I'm watching something (it is really helpfull) ; • And I miss the fact that, when I turn back on the description of the series with multiples seasons (e.g. Grey's Anatomy), the app doesn't stay at an episode from a further season. Il always have to find back where I was. These two things excluded, this is app whitch offers a good utilisator experience and the cllors are really nice !

Was a good app and now has for some reason stopped streaming on my phone as well as on my tv. Tried to doing everything: restarting WiFi, reinstalling the app, made sure my phone was compatible (and it is), restarted my phone, literally everything - doesn't work anymore. Reported at least good 6 times, didn't get it fixed. Quite disappointed!

Nothing against the company, just the app itself. The UI sucks I cant change to another app to answer a message without having to go through the main menu again to back my show. Other video provider's apps dont do that and it's a super convenient feature! You have great content. By making it more user friendly and more accommodating to people, they're more likely to include you in their life overall.

The worst app ever!!! It doesn't travel with the user. Going into a different country should mean the ability to use the app only with different content and still being able to watch the company's original work. But with this app you can't. You can't even cancel your subscription if you leave the area in which you made the original subscription. Add to that, nit being able to subscribe again because for some unknown reason they won't send the ORP .. This app is not good

A lot of the original Disney content is still not on the app. Example, the new Aladdin movie. Also I have noticed a big technical glitch when watching something on the app it's meant to remember where you stopped. This doesn't seem to be the case it puts me back about 3 episodes behind that I have already seen. For a company leading in entertainment a simple app shouldn't be too difficult

Crashes every time I try to connect to chrome cast says "undefined app error" and my movie night was ruined. Thanks Disney. Edit... the problem was solved but now my "continue watching" feed is full with things I already finish watching, that is very anoying as a person with OCD this bothers me more than it should. But regardless I would love the app working properly.
WAY too many commercials! It's just about unwatchable.

App is useless. Constantly freezing and becoming unresponsive. Stuck with never ending downloads - can't cancel the downloads, can't access settings while content is downloading, can't load any more screens, and it's slowing down my entire phone. Can't play any downloaded content - just gets stuck on a black screen with 0:00 timecode.

I know they just launched the service so it's not gonna be perfect. In terms of content, it's great. In terms of interface and consumer experience, could be worked on. Would like to see a section where I can continue shows where I left off. Also progress bars on each episode would be great to know how much of the episode you have watched and also tells you that you've already watched it. Chromecast casting has also been buggy!

Wish that we can change what the app suggests for viewing. Maybe add a thumbs up/down option or remove suggestion. It's aggravating to constantly be suggested the same things you have no interest to watch or always suggesting things that we've already seen on multiple lists. I've been a subscriber for two years now and it's getting boring. Plus, I keep getting error 84 when I try to sign in to watch downloaded movies when offline. Can we fix this?

So many bugs... The latest is NO OPTION TO CAST - the cast icon has completely disappeared. I've tried CS who couldn't grasp what I was saying (yet told me it was a known issue?) and they told me to just keep "downloading the app" and then to cast it to a tv with Chromecast instead of using a smart tv... Yeah, that would be great, EXCEPT THERE IS NO CAST ICON TO CAST FROM 😠 No response from emailing, live chat was a waste of time. They'll take your money, but don't expect sensible service.
BEST APP EVER. Not too expensive and has so many shows and movies from my childhood. Highly recommend!

It's sad that the buggy app prevents using this otherwise nice service. The app didn't work on my device for months and now that it started to work and I mistakenly stopped the subscription, re-enabling doesn't work.. The app just hangs. So I'll let it be and use some other service instead. Please get proper developers to fix, maintain, monitor and develop the app!

I have had no problems with the app until a few months ago where an error text pops up from time to time saying "can't connect to the servers. Please try again later" it doesn't go away until I deinstall and reinstall the app, which is really annoying. Would be nice if you could fix this, seems to be a problem many people have. Thank you.

Good content with great video and audio quality the problem is that it doesn't remember what you've watched in any way. If you have to stop a movie, you have to find it again in the lists and remember where you left off. Even more annoying is when your watching a series, you better remember exactly where you left off or have to watch the start of a few episodes before finding where you were at in the series. My son keeps watching the same clone wars episodes because he can never find where he is
Terrible to use, crashes all the time

I've lowered the star rating since last week. This APP is so bad for Disenys brand integrity. Really shouldn't have launched it until you had it right. What a massive disappointment to have all of the best disney movies and programmes at your fingertips for it to be ruined by buffering every few minutes. I won't be continuing with a subscription instead I will stick to Netflix and other more reliable streaming Apps. I would give it no stars if it was an option.

Serious issues need to be fixed. I live in Canada and for some reason they assume I want the text of the movie en Francais, even though I have all the settings set to English. Controls also disappear on my phone if I open any other app besides Disney plus. Unfortunately I subscribed for a year and I'm starting to think that it was a huge mistake.

Didn't want to get it, felt like Disney were monopolising kids movies. But honestly, I find the app easier to use and has far more features than Netflix or Prime. For example, last night my partner and I and our friends were able to do date night all in different towns by using video calls and Disney's group watch feature. It has made Covid restrictions so much easier on our family. Just absolutely love it.

Great content, but when you Have shows like The Simpsons with 30+ years of episodes The lack of a continue watching function seems like a huuuuge oversight, I noticed when I selected an episode I had already started it DID pick up where I left off however it's still annoying and not clear. But I have to say, this is literally my only issue so far. Aside from Disney messing with the Simpsons aspect ratio (but that's not your fault 🤣)

Slick and good UI however a few issues: - The phone app is not in sync with the playstation app as when I watch a movie on the phone and want to continue on the playstation app it doesn't register that movies having been watched therefore cannot resume - Once an episode ends it doesn't let you go to next episode seamlessly compared to Netflix or Prime - Disney seems to be drip feeding episodes (one every week or so) instead of releasing whole seasons which is a little annoying
Too many ads for such a large company. They have so much money and after you pay the fee to use the streaming service you still get ads. It's obnoxious and unnecessary.
Easy to use, good selection of programmes

The bar displaying what you are watching disappears and you can not pause unless you re launch the app. 'Continue watching' isn't accurate to where you where up to and also still shows movies you've watched till the end. If you open a series you've previously watched or are in the middle of watching the episodes don't show as watched as they do on Netflix. App need to work correctly for those of us watching on devices and casting

Really quite awful. Episodes of shows are out of order or missing entirely. If you select an episode to watch there's no option to resume watching from that point... You have to start a series in its entirety to get that option. Seriously, look at your competition... They actually know what they're doing in comparison.

Stalls quite a bit (using Chromecast). Downloaded it for my son so he can watch the lion guard but they don't have the latest season and it doesn't have continuous play. You have to select the next episode after one ends. Once I pressed play for the next episode, it started casting the previous one again. This happened a couple of times. Otherwise, it's okay.

Overall, it has been an amazing experience to have Disney + streaming service. The are a few things that I may improve: -On "continue watching" to be able to access the previous episodes and not only the one I was watching. And maybe be able to access all seasons and episodes as well. -On my phone the app has really come in handy, although some times when I cycle from D+ to my other apps and back, the sounds is off and I can't control the volume anymore... Aside from that I am extremely happy!!

A great service with awesome content. I would like to offer some feedback for the Android mobile app. The list of continue watching always seems to disappear after a week or so except the most recently viewed. I would also appreciate a lock screen option to prevent accidental touching. A way to minimise the screen which still playing would be great to allow me to answer messages received while still watching. It frequently logs me out, which can be frustrating.

Obviously great library to choose from. Great originals especially the Marvel series are awesome. The app is a bit lack luster though - having finished an episode you first have to skip to the end to get to the next episode. The video quality of downloads varies within one download. and a couple of minor bugs overall you can't avoid this if you want Disney/Marvel content, but the app really just isn't great.

Content is amazing since Disney seem to own everything. However, the app itself needs a lot more work - a good start would be the whole "Continue Watching" section. ** Note the sarcasm - other platforms have these functions.** 1. Would it be too much to ask for the app to track episodes/scenes where you've left off? 2. Need an option to clear things off the continue watching list. Mostly b/c the app enjoys saying I have a few minutes left on a movie but I've let the credits run.
