Update: Some companies just shouldn't be in the streaming business. This app is a perfect example. Downgrading from 2 stars to 1 star _________________ 1. Very very low volume over Google TV. It's in audible even with the soundbar at full volume. 2. Shows don't allow you to skip to the next episode until the full credits play out - some of those last for 5 mins especially for the mini series. 3. If you're scrolling on a list there isn't an option to jump to search while using the Google remote
Specifically to PS4 and Xbox, we no longer see a continue watching list, unfortunately.

App hasn't worked properly since the last Android/OneUI 3.0 update from Samsung. Either the content won't play or attempting to play will crash and reboot my phone. Surely Disney should have the resources to keep up with compatibility! Restarting my phone seems to help, as long Disney+ is then the first app I use. Other than this deeply egregious bug, the app does exactly what you'd want it to do.

I would love to give this app a five star rating because I love almost everything about it. My favourite things in one place, Marvel and Disney, it lets me discover new favourites. The only downfall I've found is that you can't have it playing in the background like you can on things like the Netflix and NowTV apps. If you get a message or want to check Facebook, etc, you have to come off the movie/TV show and then go back to it after. If it played in the background it would definitely be a 5.

Deleted previous review to add more feedback: screen brightness within the app is significantly lower than phone screen brightness. If I compare to Netflix for example, the contrast and brightness there is much better and provides a much clearer image. Night scenes are therefore very difficult to see. Edit: LG webOS smart TV feedback. Regularly experiencing long buffer times especially in the evenings. Cross checked against Netflix at those times and no problems. Also checked router.
Connection drops and app crashes frequently. No other streaming service we use does this

App not much to be desired. Such a badly designed app, it's so bad when you're casting to your TV, it wont resume a show. It will always start the show or movie from start and most times it wont even start casting. To many times do I need to restart the app until it works. Of all the different streaming apps i use, non have issues
my app is stuck on Spanish, and I can't find a language setting

When pausing a series, playing afterwards disrupts the auto-play for the next episode. Annoying. Not being able to skip to the next episode is a little annoying too. Decent range of content, but the app on phone (and PlayStation) is buggy and cuts out a fair amount. There are some things that other streaming services get right, Disney+ should take note and build them in as well

If i choose to download into external storage, the app will not be able to play the video & the app will crash. I can only download into internal storage in order to watch the video. I'm currently using my Android phone and cast it on my TV using google Chromecast. The problem is after every episode, it doesn't auto play the next episode. I have to use my phone to play the next episode. The control at the bottom of the screen should also include "previous/next episode" in addition to skip 10s.

Edit: The issue was fixed after the latest update for the app in WebOS. Subtitle English CC keeps disappearing for tens of minutes even though it's turned on still. It will refuse to actually work for a while. It's really frustrating. This is happening on the newest version of Web OS, LG C2 OLED. Obviously I tried everything. Reinstalling the app, resetting the TV, changing to different subtitles and back to EN, setting up the subtitle settings in the mobile app, but the issue still persists.

I like the catalogue of content. A few gems missing in terms of Disney Channel shows but alright overall. My issue is there's no way to edit my watch history, like if I start to watch something and then don't wanna finish it, it just sits in my 'continue watching' unless I finish it which by doing so messes with the algorithm. Also, Disney+ is the only streaming service I have that won't cast to my TV or ChromeCast. I'm not sure what the problem is but please look into it.

Not only does it not run properly on my ps4, to the extent its unusable, it now constantly messes up on my phone. God forbid you should want to rewind anything. If you do, ecpect it just completely mess up the app, and youll get about 1 sec of viewing, then 3 secs of the bufffer circle, over and over again until it crashes the app, or freezes your phone/ps4. Avoid! Dont pay the subscription price, as they seem to not want to do any work to make the app funtional, on any format.

Can't even use the app. When I would try to watch anything about 5-10 minutes in my whole phone would crash I have a LG G5. I've never experienced that before with my phone and I've had it for 3 yrs I then tried to use it on my laptop and nothing would load, it kept giving me a "something is wrong right now try again later error code 83". Nothing would work. Just got sick of trying to figure out why nothing was working. Maybe when the app is more improved I'll try it again. Very disappointing.

this app used to work well, though I didn't personally use it that much my family members used it regularly. Recently, like within the past month the app will not open on any of our devices (TV, tablet, phones etc). When the app did use to work it would sometimes stop the video you're watching and say an error has occurred. By far the worst streaming app, will not be renewing my subscription next month.

Do not work well with Chromecast, its just a trash comparing to Netflix. It does not matter if you have an amazing content but it does not work well with a simple and most used casting device. Another terrible problem is that it just stoped working after the update to the latest version. I really would like to give ZERO stars!

Such a frustrating app. After downloading one or two movies for the kids to watch offline the app becomes unusable. You tap something and the spinning thing comes up... wait for 5 minutes to respond, and repeat. The only way to make it usable again is to uninstall and reinstall. But then if you download something again it turns to rubbish again. The Netflix app on the same device (it's a Nokia T20 tablet) works perfectly.

Lacks in content, hopefully they will add more stuff and complete the collection of some film series they have, it's frustrating, when your watching a series and some films in between are missing, i.e. (X-men series is incomplete). Other than that it's a good app, works perfectly fine, aswell it should be, paying enough for it.

Great content! Needs more features: 1. Mine disconnects from chromecast every few episodes. I've got to connect something else like Netflix, then connect Disney again before it works. 2. When I've turned my screen off, and then I go back into the app, the episode or movie starts from the beginning again.

The app will not even load once. I have have reinstalled and restarted multiple times. I have a Google Pixel 2 XL running Android 10. Update: Emailed Disney+ got an automated email to try ringing or chatting. Went with chat, tried twice with Manuel and Pong. I was unresponsive apparently (I sent multiple messages). I am almost certain I was talking with bots. In summary, if you have problems with this just delete and ignore it.

Currently unusable. Frequent issues with the app scince the beginning. Keep getting error 83 for the last month on my android phone and Chromecast and will not login at all. Bought an Amazon Fire stick and the issue still happens. Issue does not happen on an iPhone, PC or Roku smart TV. Tested on Android phone off my home network and it's still an issue. Reinstalling app or clearing cache doesn't work

Got the app so could watch offline movies, but it's telling me to connect to internet. Found I need to start app while connected to internet, then I can go offline (airplane mode), but sometimes it looses it, if I pause movie it sometimes will say it needs internet to continue. Unreliable offline mode not much good if you are far far away from internet. I won't be renewing unless this gets fixed.

I absolutely love the content in this app although there is constant issues with the shows loading and reloading and just not working the app constantly shuts itself off and just genuinely doesn't work the best. Will continue to use as I like the shows on it but wouldnt personally recommend to anyone.

Yes they have some great content but if the app won't play it - which far too often it is unable to - it becomes a mute argument...much like any decision you have to make about what to watch unless it's on another service of course. Interest speeds topi g out at 107 to 120 mbps, but it still freezes all the time....so frustrating. I would recommend binging what you must see and them ditching them as the app is concentrated frustration.
it won't show what's available before you subscribe to itit just goes back to the regular screenso I have no way of knowing what's on this channel

Decent app with lots of content but I've tried watching movies/shows or even just updating settings/adding a new device on my phone and it becomes unresponsive, ends up freezing my phone...most times I just have to wait it out but once in a while I'll end up having to restart the device...its not like I have an old phone or a bunch of apps running in the background. Gets pretty irritating

I like Disney plus itself. Unfortunately unlike Netflix you have to refresh your sign in to watch downloaded movies or episodes. This is a pain as sometimes you are in the middle of nowhere on a road trip and you can't watch the next episode because there is no internet. This needs to be fixed ASAP! This is why I only gave it 3 stars. Another problem is even when downloaded the app buffers and stalls the show I'm watching from time to time. Downloaded equals no buffering and no internet
Normally I would give full five stars, but they added ads, which is ridiculous in my opinions because we pay a monthly fee to watch a bug variety of movies WITHOUT any ads interrupting.

The app is good, easy to navigate and well suited for both mobile and television. So far, I've been having a pretty great experience! My only nitpick is that when wanting to download a movie on mobile it doesn't seem to show what the download size is unless it's from a TV series? Maybe I'm not looking hard enough, but in the details it doesn't seem to say. Otherwise, recommended!

Day 1 of subscription; Downloaded a season of a show to watch offline and it worked fine. Went to watch the show while I was offline, no internet connections available and I struggled to get the app to play anything. Was somehow able to watch the first 2 episodes after fighting with the app for 10 minutes each episode, restarted app and no longer works at all. The app will not play videos or accept the correct pin input and now will not log me in at all. This app is garbage. Waste of money.

How is it that on every device i own, on any corner of the planet, it takes 3 attempts to play a video without the app crashing or doing nothing for 5 minutes? This is the only app that malfunctions anywhere near this magnitude. Mind you this is an app full of children's content, which is not a patient audience. This is the ONLY video app that is this bad. And your menu UI is garbage slow. I'd say anyone involved in writing this app should be embarrassed, but you should never write code again.

The app itself is fine. I mainly use Disney+ on my pc or ps4 without any issues, but literally (I've counted) 6/8 times I've tried opening the app, just to check if a show is in the library, the servers are down. It's not my internet-connection, as it's been happening regardless of the four different connections I've been using, and it's been working perfectly fine on my other devices while the problem persists on android.

This app signs me out frequently. Almost every time I want to watch something. Especially when I'm offline, trying to watch things I've downloaded. The whole point of downloading things is that I shouldn't have to use the internet or waste my data, but I have to almost every time I want to open the app and am forced to log in every time. It's very irritating. I've heard other people have had similar issues with this app. Would appreciate it being fixed.

This app is just terrible. I tried to watch movies on here but its constantly freezing. The damn movie would freeze for half an hour then it will only show me 5 minutes and freeze again.......so stupid. I do not recommend this app. Go back to Netflix lol that's what I did, if it was my phone then Netflix wouldn't work either but it runs perfectly. Disney+ could learn a thing or two from them and should ask them for advice haha

Been getting the spinning circle for over a year. Force stop, cleared data and cache. Same problem. Reinstalled. Same problem. Restarted. No help. Simply doesn't work. Most useless streaming app on my phone. And now they want an extra $3 per month. Cancelling. My daughter I will learn to live without Marvel and The Simpsons.

Constantly logs you out and is an all around user unfriendly experience in compsrison to apps like netflix. Poorly keeps track of the shows you watch and will throw up an error almost 50% of the time you put it in the background causing you to have to type in your info again. Its only saving grace is the wide selection and the decent network connection.

Updated: Most of my early issues were launch/server load related. Have had a relatively good experience since. Still missing some features/polish that other streaming apps have, but that will come with time. Library is fantastic and quality of service is more than acceptable. Well worth the subscription price. -------- Earlier 1 star review removed due to improvements, but including this to give context to the developers reply below. Issues were launch preparedness related only.

The user interface was extremely easy to use, I could sign up quickly with no problems, i'm currently using a 7-day free trial for the Disney+ subscription.So far, I've watch so many films this week,war more than Netflix! Also I was shocked at the detail the app had,there was numerous films,and you could even download them to watch it in online.All in all, this is a great app with so many genres,I might just buy an annual or monthly subscription,I love it!
Need to stop glitching with trying to pick episodes it keeps picking different episodes of the season from the one

Trouble watching anything, sometimes it works, but drains an enormous amount of battery while heading the phone to the max. Downloading episodes is also super slow and deleting downloads doesn't work. Opening the app settings results in a freeze, such as trying to play anything. It worked fine a while ago though.

As many other 1 and 2 star reviews recently, I also the past week have not even been able to load the app on my galaxy tab and phone. Its just freezing at the intro screen. I notice Disney are collecting my subscription fee bang on time though, and I'm sure there will be no compensation or free month for me not being able to access the content I am paying for. Clearly there's a problem with Android mobile devices. Maybe it's time to cancel and try Paramount Plus instead?

It's all old stuff, don't really see much new stuff, probably better to merge with Netflix who seem to be on their "A" game and save everyone the cost of another monthly subscription, that's giving poor value for money

Trying to monopolize your home streaming setup but failing at every turn. Error 83 on my smartphone (indicates not compatible device even though it's a brand new Samsung), app on my smart TV constantly "encounters problem, try again later", and when I log in on my MacBook to try and Chromecast to my TV it overrides the chromecast and redirects my TV to the app which doesn't work! I cannot comprehend how a company like Disney cannot simply provide its product to its paying customers.

Cancelled. App long way from competitors (PS5/Android). Subtitle w/ black background u can't remove, covers ~10% of video. On PS5, or switch apps, it doesn't save the moment you stopped, so you can't continue watching. Time bar doesn't show shots when scrolling, you can't find where u stopped. Bar is not not large enough, so watch 3h movies like Avatar on cell nearly impossible w/o rewatch chunks. Bad selectn, classics good, else, 2 much LGBT stuff >= Netflix, scary, forced. No content f adults
It keeps giving me the error message your charging hella money for this app but can't fix your bugs 🙄

There's been this glitch with Disney. I can't watck any shows and it isn't my internet, I've tried offing it and on(ING) it but it isn't working. This goes for my Samsung aswell, the loading screen takes forever and its getting very frustrating, also, a couple days ago, it kept on saying that the internet was bad when it wasn't! My internet was perfectly fine but Disney kept on saying that the connection wasn't intact and we had to wait a very long time, please fix this.

The content is great but the app is absolutely awful. Sack whoever is doing your app development. I have been trying to watch on the latest Samsung ultra tablet but I either the ratio is such that I will have to watch and lose half the image or zoom out and have the image surrounded by inch thick black bars that render most of my screen unused. This isn't rocket science and is the single reason I won't subscribe beyond the free trial. Thank goodness for bittorrent.
variety of movies and classic Disney films plus I have hulu.

Error code 42 on my Roku devices. Error code 41 on my Android devices. It works one day and then doesn't work the next. Support has been useless in resolving the issues. Chat with them. They tell memthey will get back to me in 24 hours but I get nothing back from them. As for content, huge back library but really very little in new content.
not enough content for the price

Totally pathetic . I have two android boxes and Google Play keeps telling me not compatible with my device. It was prior to updates. Disney don't seem to care at all I have been in contact with their support team completely useless total waste of time. They never did return calls or follow up with issues as they said they would. Not impressed at all .

The content on this app is fantastic and is definitely worth the $90 Canadian a year. However the user interface, while still usable, still needs to catch up with Netflix. Some features, such as the ability to rate a program, are missing and make the app feel incomplete. Those are just minor nitpicks though.
if we pay for a subscription we shouldn't have any ads at all. that's my only complaint as of right now. aside from that I enjoy the app.

Having all the Disney movies and shows are awesome. But the app is complete GARBAGE. it never loads properly, I constantly get error messages. Casting is a huge issue. What am I paying for? Even once I get the show or movie to start its constantly loading and freezing. Please fix it.

The content and the visual layout is amazing for what disney offers. But the app itself keeps playing up for me constantly. Constantly stuck on loading screen opening app. 8/10 times it's stuck. Keep having to uninstall app to get it working. And the app can buffer a fair bit when watching shows. I would put more stars but the app is like its broken and I can't watch anything most of the time cause its stuck on the disney+ loading screen.

The crashing of the app and the issue are just to much. I paid for the year already or I'd have just cancelled until the app gets its bug fixed. I understand it's a new app and it was done at launch so I'm not going to do a one star cuz I'm sure it'll get updated. When it works smoothly I'll definitely change the rating. It's just a company like Disney that makes a billion a movie if expect a little better. Update: already getting better which is appreciated. Keep them coming

I've tried on 2 different phones and different internet connections and have come across the same error. Once downloading for the first time ever, it will work fine for a little bit. Then the app stops working. When I reopen, I keep getting an error message saying that I cannot connect to the Disney+ servers and to try again later. I have uninstalled, reinstalled, cleared data and caches and I still keep receiving this error message. This same issue has happened on 2 different Android devices.

I like the library where nothing ever goes away so there's absolutely no rush to finish a series (looking at you Netflix!). Downside for me is when it comes to downloading. I repeatedly get an error (I think code 39) where it renders ALL downloads unwatchable and I need to download it all again. Another (minor) downside is that the option to delete an episode and automatically download the next one when D+ connects to WiFi.

It's impossible to watch non-English language things on this app. The subtitles just do not load fast enough, and the audio and video desync sometimes in the process. Trying to watch Shogun on this is difficult enough to ruin the viewing experience.

Great content, woeful app. App constantly logs out on devices, logging in either takes a long time to load or errors out with "unable to access service, if persists try again later". Not acceptable for a service with a paid subscription. I have plenty of free apps that never have these kinds of issues. Pick up your game please, Disney.

My password keeps randomly getting reset which is such bs I'm to the point when it comes to renewal that I will not be renewing. And my devices keep getting kicked out I shouldn't have to keep reseting my password and keep logging in
Already had a subscription and couldn't get it back and it tried to charge me again for another one when all it had to do was update itself 😠

Since the last update, I'm unable to log in on my mobile, the front page keeps logging, and when it comes to type the PIN in, shows error code 83 or that my pin code is incorrect (which is impossible) or that there is a problem with my network speed. I haven't checked on my Xbox yet as I haven't got much time to watch. And when I have, the app is not working at all. Rubbish! Fix it please....

Not too happy with this app. It's chewed up my data even when the settings are on the lowest data usage. For days it wasn't working and kept saying it couldn't connect to itself. I downloaded a few things a week ago so I could watch them without my internet being on, but after finally getting into the app after it not working, it's deleted my downloads even though I was charged the data for it. They need to do some serious updating and bug fixes. Waste of my money for the subscription.
